texts.es: Blanca Esther de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la agricultura y pesca desde hace ya varios años, es una mujer humilde, decidida y emprendedora quiere un futuro mejor para ella y su familia que es lo mas importante y lo que la impulsa a buscar mejores alternativas de vida, habita en una zona rural del país y en su vivienda no posee luz eléctrica, hoy  en dia es una necesidad básica para el hogar y Blanca sabe que es muy fundamental para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar una lámpara ahorrativa ecológica que  le brinde una solución efectiva y amigable a su entorno ya que es de bajo costo, y además con energía auto renovable, es justo lo que ella necesita para que existiera luz por la noche en su vivienda. Blanca Esther esta muy contenta  y entusiasmada con el apoyo, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Blanca Esther, 44 years old, lives with her life partner and their children in their own home. She has worked in agriculture and fishing for several years. She is a humble, dedicated, and enterprising woman who wants a better future for herself and her family. To her, this is the most important thing and it is what drives her to search for better alternatives. She lives in a rural area of the country and her home does not have electric lighting. These days, this is a basic necessity for the home, and Blanca knows that lighting is fundamental for her family to have a better quality of life. Therefore, she decided to request a loan from Integral. This loan will allow her to buy an environmentally-friendly lamp. This gives her an effective solution to her problem since it is low in cost, and it also uses renewable energy resources. This is just what she needs in order to have lighting at night in her home. Blanca Esther is very happy and enthusiastic for the help, and assures that she will pay off her debt. She also has confidence in God that he will provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy an environmentally-friendly lamp

loans.name: Hernan Gilberto

texts.es: Hernán Gilberto de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus hijos y su madre en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura y pesca artesanal, desde hace ya varios años, es un hombre dedicado a su labor, decidido y emprendedor quiere un futuro mas prospero para él y su familia que es lo mas importante y lo que la impulsa a buscar mejores alternativas de vida, habita en una zona rural del país y en su vivienda no posee luz eléctrica, en estos días es una necesidad básica para el hogar y Hernán esta consiente que es muy indispensable para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida, por eso decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar una lámpara ahorrativa ecológica que le brinde una solución eficaz para su entorno, es a un precio cómodo al bolsillo, y además con energía auto renovable, es precisamente lo que el necesita para que exista luz por la noche en su vivienda. Hernán Gilberto esta muy feliz y satisfecho con el apoyo, asegura que cancelará la deuda y a la vez tiene fe en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
27-year old Hernán Gilberto lives with his wife, children, and mother in his own home. He has worked in agriculture and fishing for several years. He is a committed, enterprising and hardworking man who wishes to provide himself and his family with a more prosperous future. This is very important for him and gives him the motivation to look for better ways of life. He lives in a rural area; his home doesn't have electricity. These days that is a necessity, and Hernán is aware how important it is that his family has a better standard of living.

He has decided to approach INTEGRAL for a loan to buy environmentally sound lighting  for his home. Renewable energy will provide an efficient and inexpensive solution and is exactly what he needs so that he has light at night in his home. 

Hernán Gilberto is very happy and satisfied with the assistance provided by the loan. He promises to pay back the money and at the same time has faith that God will provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: Buy environmentally sound lighting for his house

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a food vendor. She sells Ga-kenkey and serves it with okra soup and fish at Akonoma near Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall in which she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Akonoma near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Aba has been baking for 34 years now.  She uses her income  to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business from the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is 23 years old, single, lives with his parents and has earned a living for the last two years by selling snacks. Each month, he earns about 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to meet his basic needs. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to our organization by a KADET staff member. Timothy will use this loan to furnish his shop and buy fruit to sell to his customers. He will use the profits he expects to earn to educate his siblings. His dream for the future is to open a hotel.

loans.use: to furnish his shop and buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize). Abana has been in this business for some time now. Abena lives together with her 5 children at Akonma near  Cape Coast. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Abana will use her loan to purchase bags of maize  for the production of kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Abana plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Narek

texts.en: Narek is a 25-year-old farmer who lives with his parents in the town of Yeghegnadzor. To earn a living, he grows nut, apple, pear, peach and apricot trees. He also has two cows and six chickens. Despite his young age, Narek already has 10 years of experience in this field and really enjoys his work. He is requesting a loan to buy more cows because this will allow him to earn additional income. This extra income will help Narek ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy special milk cows.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old, married and has six children. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 10000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and additional piglets to raise.

Teresita has been pig fattening for 14 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 22 years old, married and the mother of three young children who lives in Getafe, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman, and Regina is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for his boat. This will allow her husband to go fishing again. Regina hopes to make a difference in her family's life by working hard and taking advantage of the financial services offered by CEVI to micro-entreprenneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for a fishing boat.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. They have been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. 

Marcela is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and buckets for storage. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Marcela hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and buckets for storage.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Esther works very hard to support her family. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines, and supplements her income by buying and selling rice. Esther is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, including spices, soft drinks and canned goods. She has sustained her business through five previous loans from NWTF and hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José Santos de treinta y un años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la pesca artesanal y agricultura desde hace ya varios años, es un hombre emprendedor, honesto y muy luchador quiere un futuro mejor para el y su familia que es lo primordial y lo que lo impulsa a buscar mejores oportunidades de vida, habita en una zona rural del país y en su vivienda no posee energía eléctrica, y en estos tiempos para el hogar la luz es una necesidad básica, que les permite obtener una mejor calidad de vida José esta plenamente consiente que es muy indispensable por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar una lámpara ahorrativa ecológica que le brinde una solución eficiente para su entorno, es a bajo costo y además con energía auto renovable, es exactamente lo que el necesita para que su vivienda ofrezca mejores condiciones de vida. José Santos agradece desde ya la ayuda por recibir y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Santos, 31 years old, lives with his life partner and his children in his own house. He has been engaged in traditional fishing and agriculture for many years now. He is an enterprising, honest, and very determined man. He wants a better future for him and his family, which is fundamental and what drives him to look for better opportunities in life. He lives in a rural zone of the country and in his home he does not have electricity. These days, electricity in the home is a basic necessity, which permits them to obtain a better quality of life. 

José is fully aware that it is very indispensable, and therefore he decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy an ecological energy-saver lamp that provides him with an efficient solution for his environment. It costs less and furthermore, with auto-renewable energy, it is exactly what he needs for his home to offer better living conditions. José Santos is already appreciative of the help he is about to receive and assures you that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time he is confident in that God will offer his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy an ecological energy-saver lamp.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years old and is cheerful, friendly, honest, and hardworking. She lives with her husband and children in Msambweni, the province of Coast. She sells fish from her home.

Beatrice is taking her first loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy stocks of fish, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan. Due to a lack of working capital, her business is low on stock, which causes her to have poor income for providing for her family. With this investment Beatrice will achieve better sales and improved income, which will help her to provide for her children, giving them food and an education, which are the most important things.

Her dream is to continue in good health and to work for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish, cooking oil, and a bigger frying pan.

loans.name: Yisinta

texts.en:
Yisinta is 19 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Yisinta has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Yisinta has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil for resale, and will help Yisinta to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Yisinta hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house and also make sure that she works hard to see that she educates her child. 

Yisinta is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano 2, se formo en el año 2010, gracias a una de las integrante, quien ya estuvo en otro comité y ya tenía experiencia, actualmente el grupo tiene 24 miembros, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para seguir adelante en los ciclos.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Romy, quien es modista, y tiene su pequeño tallercito de costura, el cual con mucho esfuerzo esta sacando adelante. Comenta Romy que por medio de su trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Siempre está con mucho trabajo y es que eso es muy bueno, porque la ayuda a seguir con sus metas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The loan committee of women called San Cayetano 2 was formed in the year 2010 thanks to one of the members who was already on another committee and already had experience. Currently the group has 24 members. They all work and help one another get ahead in the loan cycles. 

One of the members is Romy. She is modest and has a small sewing workshop that she is putting a lot of effort into pushing forward. She says that through her work, she gives her family what they need for a decent life without hardship. She always has a lot of work, which is very good because it helps her move towards her goals. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and other ingredients to be able to fill her orders and thus continue working.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, buttons, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase goats and cows

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives together with the husband who is a teacher and her five children at Akonma near Cape Coast. Ekua produces kenkey to sell. (Kenkey is an African dish made out of maize.). Ekua has been in this business for some time now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey to sell. With the new profit, Ekua plan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Araceli is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Araceli has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from her general store business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik lives in Malishka village in the Vayots Dzor region with her husband and son. Together with her husband, Knarik runs a farm and keeps livestock. She grows peach, pear, apple, apricot and nut trees. Currently, her livestock consists of four cows and eight chickens.

Knarik has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the cattle in winter. As agriculture is the only source of income for this family, the loan is very important for Knarik.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cattle

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es: Leónides de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura y pesca desde hace ya varios años, es un hombre humilde, decidido y luchador quiere un futuro mejor para el y su pequeña familia que es lo mas importante y lo que la impulsa a buscar mejores oportunidades de vida, habita en una zona muy humilde del país y en su vivienda no posee luz eléctrica, en estos tiempos es una necesidad básica para el hogar y Leónides esta seguro que es muy indispensable para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar una lámpara ahorrativa ecológica que  le brinde una solución efectiva para su entorno ya que es a un precio accesible, y además con energía auto renovable, es exactamente lo que el necesita para que exista luz por la noche en su vivienda. Leónides esta muy agradecido y entusiasmado con el apoyo, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en: Leónides, forty-six, lives with his partner and their children in their own house.  For several years he has earned his living by farming and fishing.  He's a modest, determined, and persistent man.  He wants a better future for himself and his small family, which is most important to him and impels him to seek better opportunities in life.  He lives in a very modest area of the country and his house doesn't have electricity.  In these times that's a basic home necessity and Leónides is sure that it's indispensable if his family is to have a better quality of life.  That's why he decided to seek a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy a low-cost energy-saving lamp that will provide an effective solution for the home environment because it is priced accessibly and, because it uses renewable energy, it's exactly what he needs to light his house at night.  He is really excited and appreciates the support.  He assures us that he'll pay it off and at the same time he hopes God will grant his family the full life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy a low-cost energy saving lamp.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store, like soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. Gloria earns more income from food vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store, like soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a food vender. She cooks plain rice and vegetable stew for sale. This she has done for three years. 

She lives together with her husband and two children in Akonoma near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.    

Charlotte will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients for preparing her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients for preparing her food  to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 25 years old and married with one kid.

Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell, like soap, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

Edna has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Edna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell, like soap, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, a hardworking entrepreneur, has been operating her general store business in the Philippines for one year now. She earns additional income from food vending, and is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of sardines, soap, bread, biscuits, spices, etc. for her store.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of sardines, soap, bread, biscuits, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 29 years old and married to Mohamed. They have two sons and one daughter. Previously, she was just a wife taking care of the house.  With great effort, she was able to open a small business where she sells dumplings for breakfast during the morning hours.

Her customers comment that her dumplings are hygienic and delicious, which is why they prefer buying from her. This has made her have a good number of regular customers. Since demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this but doesn't have enough working capital, she is asking for support in the form of a loan to buy ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, and food flavors. 

Mariam promises to pay her loan punctually, which will enable her to be entrusted with more loans from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, and food flavors.

loans.name: Kiplangat

texts.en:
Kiplangat is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children that he supports. He has been running a retail shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He has applied for a business loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products, e.g. cooking oil, maize flour and crates of milk for sale.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion as well as to diversify into livestock keeping. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to increase the consumable goods in his retail shop.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica al trabajo de ordenanza en una empresa cercana a la localidad donde vive desde hace ya varios años, es una mujer dedicada a su labor, decidida y luchadora quiere un futuro mejor para ella y su familia que es lo mas importante y lo que la impulsa a buscar mejores alternativas de vida, habita en una zona humilde del país y en su vivienda necesitan luz eléctrica, pues es algo básico para el hogar, Roxana sabe que es muy fundamental para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida por eso le ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar una lámpara ahorrativa ecológica que  le brinde luz de calidad y a bajo costo en su vivienda. Roxana Elizabeth esta muy alegre y entusiasmada con el apoyo, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Roxana Elizabeth, 36, lives with her mother in a house of her own; she has worked as a messenger for a local firm near her place of residence for several years now.  She’s a determined, tenacious woman who is dedicated to her work and who wants a better future for her and her family which is what’s most important and what pushes her to seek better life alternatives.  She lives in a very humble part of the country and they need electricity at home because it’s a basic household need.  Roxana knows that it’s fundamental for her family to have a better quality of life which is why she’s asked Integral for a loan to buy an ecological, energy-saving lamp that will provide quality, low-cost light at home.  Roxana Elizabeth is very cheerful and enthusiastic about the support and is sure that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time trusts in god that she will be able to provide her family with the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy an ecological, energy-saving lamp.

loans.name: Sandra Emerita

texts.es: Sandra Emérita de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa de habitación, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace ya varios años, es una mujer humilde, decidida y emprendedora quiere un futuro mejor para ella y los miembros de su hogar que son lo mas importante y lo que la impulsa a buscar mejores oportunidades de vida, en su vivienda necesitan energía eléctrica ahorrativa que mejore su calidad de vida, pues hoy  en dia es una necesidad fundamental, Sandra no tiene referencias crediticias pero se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar una lámpara ecológica que  le brinde una solución efectiva y amigable a su entorno ya que es de bajo costo, y además con energía auto renovable. Sandra Emérita esta muy feliz y satisfecha con el apoyo, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez tiene fe en Dios que le ofrecerá a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Sandra Emérita, 32, lives with her family in a house; she’s been selling tortillas for several years now.  She’s humble, determined, enterprising woman who wants a better future for her and her family; this is what’s most important to her and what pushes her to seek better life opportunities.  She needs to have low-cost electricity at home that will improve their quality of life because this is a basic need nowadays.  Sandra does not have credit references but has decided to ask Integral for a loan to buy an ecological lamp that will provide her with an effective, friendly solution in her environment that’s low-cost and also a source of renewable energy.  Sandra Emérita is very happy and satisfied with the support and assures that she’ll repay the loan.  At the same time, she trusts in God that she’ll be able to provide her family with the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy an ecological lamp.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 55 years old and is a dairy farmer. She is a single mother of three children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past fourteen years. She has a monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. Irene will use the loan to buy animal feed and a heifer. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land and venture into the mixed crop farming business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a heifer

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama produces kenkey for sale (kenkey is an African dish made out of maize). In the picture above, Ama is getting the maize ready for her kenkey production.     

She has been in this business for some time now. Ama lives together with her three children at Akonma near Cape Coast  She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of the kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of the kenkey for sale

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 57 years old and married. She has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lucena is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF, to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lucena has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Besarion

texts.en:
Besarion is 30 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District in East Georgia. Besarion has a large family: a wife, two infant children, parents and a grandmother who is provided with a retirement pension. He requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, Besarion has a 0.5 hectare vineyard and 27 persimmon trees. They produce wine and sell the cheese locally in an open market.  It is hardly enough food for such a large family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Besarion requested a loan from Credo to start-up his family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of thei low income. With the received credit, Besarion will purchase a car. As their existing income isn’t enough for the family, and their living conditions are poor, Besarion decided to work as a taxi driver after buying the car. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Yeranuhi

texts.en:
Yeranuhi runs a bakery. She started the business two years ago and since then has gained a large number of loyal customers. Yeranuhi would like to increase the production of bread to meet the rising demands of her customers. 

She has applied for this loan to purchase necessary flour for the production. This will help Yeranuhi to increase sales and business income. 
Yeranuhi lives with her son and daughter. Additional income is vital for her to sustain a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is a married woman and a mother of six young children from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Rolina is asking for a loan to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market.

Rolina dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will continue to generate income necessary for their needs and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repair of the boat

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Margret is 23 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills and her child. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 47-years-old business lady. She is married to Danshon, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been rearing poultry for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the service by KADET LTD staff. Janet will use the loan to buy chicks and poultry feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks and  poultry feed.

loans.name: Jackline's' Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Jackline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small vendor business, which sells fresh fruit. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fruit for resale and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay for her medical bills. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house and also make sure that she works hard to see that she educates her child up to the university level. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Unidas con el  deseo inmenso de superación de sus familias continúan en lucha de alcanzar  sus objetivos. Actualmente estan en el Décimo tercer ciclo que se formo en la Ciudad de Caaguazú, integradas con señoras con gran espíritu emprendedor,  que se esfuerzan mucho.
Gloria es parte de este grupo, ella tiene un salón de belleza, con todo lo que necesita para poder dar una buena atención a su clientela. Es una muy buena persona, que desea salir adelante y es por ello que se esfuerza todos los días para ir superándose.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, spray, agua oxigenada, shampoo, tijeras y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of the loan committee “Mujeres Unidas,” or “United Women,” continue with immense drive towards their goal to improve their families. They are currently in their thirteenth loan cycle. The group was formed in the city of Caaguazú and is made up of hardworking women with a great enterprising spirit.

Gloria is a part of this group. She has a beauty salon and has everything that she needs to give good service to her customers. She is a very good person who wants to get ahead in life, which is why she works hard every day towards improving herself. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase dyes, spray, hydrogen peroxide, shampoo, scissors, and other supplies to continue working.

loans.use: purchase dyes, spray, hydrogen peroxide, shampoo, scissors, and other supplies a beauty salon

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia continúa en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa y trabaja como profesora. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para uso personal desea pagar gastos de la familia como agua, luz y otras cosas mas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in one of Asociación Arariwa’s communal banks and working as a teacher.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family.  She requests the loan because she wants to pay some family expenses like electricity, water and other things.  She’s happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to pay some family expenses like water, electicity and others.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la comuna Padre las Casas. Ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 13 años. Realizó cursos de especialización, lo que permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Específicamente en corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas, ahora agregara depilación ya que se lo han solicitado sus clientelas, trabaja en un local que arrienda de lunes a domingos desde las 14ºº horas hasta las 22ºº horas, durante la mañana se dedica a vender carteras y chaquetas de cuero en diferentes empresas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras y locales que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello.
Con el crédito comprará productos de peluqueria, una olla y camilla para realizar depilaciones.
Una de las metas de Maria es poder comprar el local que arrienda y ser propietaria de su propio local de peluquería, y así generar mayores ingresos para brindarle un buen bienestar económico a su familia.
Maria vive junto a su esposo, un hijo de 24 años de edad, quien se encuentra en la Universidad y una hija de 13 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando en el colegio. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poder comprar el local que arrienda para poder agrandar su negocio.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "Los Luceros [Bright Stars]" Communal Bank, in the town of Padre las Casas in the city of Temuco.  She has made a living in her beauty salon for thirteen years.  She took specialized courses, which allowed her to perfect her skills and start her business, specifically cutting, styling, and coloring hair.  Now she's adding hair-removal services in response to client demand.  She works in a rented shop seven days a week from 2PM until 10PM.  Mornings she sells handbags and leather jackets at various businesses.  

She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in the city of Santiago from different distributors and shops that specialize in hair products. 

Maria plans to use her loan to buy hair-styling products, a pot, and a table for hair-removal.  One of her goals is to be able to buy the shop she now rents and be the owner of her own salon.  That way she'll generate more income to provide for the financial well-being of her family.

Maria lives with her husband, a twenty-four-year-old son who goes to the university, and a thirteen-year-old daughter who's in school.  Maria's professional dreams include being able to buy the shop so she can expand her business.  She is very glad and appreciative of the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says there's really good communication within her communal bank, and the training has served to teach her new sales and accounting strategies.  

Padre las Casa is a town in the south of Chile, near the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region.  It was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de las Casa, who defended the indigenous people during the conquest of America.  There is a heavy Mapuche population in this area, and the economy is based on agro-industry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy hair-styling products, a pot, and a table for doing hair-removal.

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja a domicilio de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, realiza específicamente corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora que se especializa en vender productos de belleza. Ademas realizara venta de café.
Con el crédito comprará descolorante, oxidante,tinturas y café.
Una de las metas de Maria es continuar con el rubro de peluquería y vender café a su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para darle un buen bienestar económico a su familia y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 23 y 17 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son  muchos a nivel personal, familiar y laboral, pero el que más desea es darles una buena educación a sus hijos para que tengan una profesión estable.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía. Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the communal bank “Los Luceros”, belonging to the municipality of Padre de Las Casas, situated in the city of Temuco.

She has made a living through heading a hairdressing salon for six years. She comments that she works at home from Monday through Saturday, and that her schedule is distributed according to her availability. She specifically cuts, styles, and dyes hair.

She buys her merchandise in a distributor that specializes in the sale of beauty products. Furthermore, she will sell coffee. With the loan she will buy hair stripper, oxidant, dye and coffee.

One of Maria’s goals is to continue hairdressing and selling coffee to her clientele, and therefore generate a higher income to give her family good economic well-being and aim for a better quality of life.

Maria lives with her husband and two children aged 23 and 17 who are studying. Many of her dreams are at a personal, family, and work level, but what she wishes for most is to give a good education to her children so that they have a stable profession.

She is very happy and appreciative of the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has provided her since it has permitted her to invest in her business.
Furthermore, she feels very comfortable in the company of the rest of the entrepreneurs of the group of the communal bank, since they share different activities and interests, which also have served her as moments of distraction. With respect to the training imparted in the meetings, she has learned the best way to manage her business.

Padre Las Casas is a municipality in the south of Chile, neighboring the city of Temuco in the Araucanía region.  Its name was given in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of the native peoples during the conquest of America. This community features a large Mapuche population. Its economy is based on agroindustry and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy hair color stripper, oxidant, dyes, and coffee.

loans.name: Alba Andrea

texts.es:
Alba, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su conyugue y dos de sus hijos.
Doña alba lleva 6 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de artículos en mal estado, como ser sillas, ventiladores, televisores, vehículos viejos, plásticos, desperdicios de hierro, cobre, aluminio y bronce. Estos artículos y materiales los vende en las fábricas de metal y reciclaje. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para la compra de un lote de materiales de metales para la venta. Este préstamo le ayudara a obtener más ingresos para su familia. Su plan es mejorar su negocio para obtener ingresos y tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Alba, 39, is married and has three children; she lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her spouse and two of their children.  Alba has been buying and selling damaged items like chairs, fans, television sets, old vehicles, plastics, discarded iron, aluminum and bronze for six years.  She sells these materials to metal foundries and recycling centers.  She’s decided to request a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy a bale of metal items to sell.  This loan will help her earn more family income.  Her plan is to improve the business to earn income and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy damaged iron, copper, aluminum, bronze and plastic items to sell for recycling.

loans.name: Koe Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Ko´eju Poty, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con once integrantes, donde todas ellas se esfuerzan y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Nelva, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Ella está creciendo de a poco  y gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y puede ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, enlatados, azúcar y demás para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: The “Ko´eju Poty” committee formed thanks to one of the member’s initiative and they are currently in the first cycle with 11 members; all of them strive because they want to reach the program’s highest level.  One of these women is Nelva who has a well-stocked grocery store.  She’s gradually growing thanks to her efforts and is able to help her family.  She’s requesting this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, canned gods, sugar, etc. to continue providing good customer service.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es: Brenda tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos y su pareja en un barrio de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula. Ella lleva 6 años dedicada a su propio negocio de venta de comida tipo Bufet. Prepara variedad de alimentos como carnes, vegetales, arroz, frijoles, ensaladas, tortillas, tacos, y otros que le solicitan. Actualmente el negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y la comida la entrega de acuerdo a pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Brenda ha decidido solicitar este préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar una estufa y un frízer para utilizarlo en su negocio de venta de comidas y atender mejor a sus clientes. En un futuro ella piensa conseguir un local más amplio como tipo repostería para mejorar su negocio y crecer en lo personal y económicamente.
texts.en:
Brenda, 28, has two children; she lives with them and with her spouse in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.  She’s been running her own business for six years.  It’s food sales buffet style.  She prepares a variety of foods like meats, vegetables, rice, beans, salads, tortillas, tacos and others as requested.  The business is currently based at home and she delivers food according to orders placed by customers.  

Brenda has decided on a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy a stove and a freezer to use in her food sales business and to provide better customer service.  In future, she’d like to get a more spacious place like a pastry shop to improve her business and grow both personally and economically.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a freezer.

loans.name: Teofilo Eulogio

texts.es:
TEOFILO EULOGIO tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Vrc La Unión, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto aguas frías, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

TEOFILO EULOGIO se dedica a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los fertlizantes que tanto le hace falta para los cultivos. 

Las compras lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es remodelar la casa. El desfío al que se enfrenta son las plagas la langosta y el orozco.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión y ver el futbool.
texts.en:
TEOFILO EULOGIO is 25 years old. He is married and has a son. He lives with his wife and son in Ventanas, Los Ríos province. 

He is a member of the La Unión communal bank. It is locaed in the community of Aguas Frías, which is in the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agriculture such as corn, rice and beans.

TEOFILO EULOGIO plants corn and beans. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizer he really needs for his crops.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to remodel his house. The challenge he faces are pests such as locusts and orozco. In his free time, he likes to watch television and soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clear her land.

loans.name: Susama

texts.en: Susama is a 36-year-old widow living with her two children who are in school. She run and manages a readymade garments shop where she sells garments for women and kids. She earns 7,000 INR per month from this business, which is not sufficient for her family. After her husband’s death, she was burdened by all her family responsibilities. She started her garment shop a few years ago. She wants to increase her stock to attract more female customers to her shop and she wants to renovate her shop. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 INR to purchase more garments in new trends and fashions and to renovate her shop. She has a dream of having her children study in a good school and providing them with all the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase more readymade garments for her shop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro sula. Doña Angela tiene 3 años de haber establecido su propio negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. vende productos alimenticios en su pulpería como ser manteca, aceite, refrescos, arroz, harina, dulces, churros, pastillas, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, condimentos, sal, café, pan, y otros abarrotes. El préstamo que ha solicitado a ODEF es su primer ciclo y es por la cantidad de 7,000 lempiras, este préstamo le ayudara a surtir mas su negocio y a generar más ingresos. Comprara granos básicos, refrescos, embutidos, productos de limpieza, pastillas, carnes y otros. Su meta es seguir apoyando  a su hija con el estudio ya que su deseo es estudiar enfermería.
texts.en: Ángela, 45, is a single mother living with her daughter in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She started her own business three years ago to earn income needed for her home.  She sells food items like lard, oil, soft-drinks, rice, flour, candy, snacks, pills, meats, dairy products, canned goods, salt, bread and other groceries in her grocery store.  The 7,000 Lempira loan she’s requested from ODEF is her first cycle and it will help her better stock the store and generate higher income.  She will buy basic grains, soft-drinks, canned goods, cleaning supplies, pills, meats and others.  Her goal is to continue to support her daughter’s schooling since she wants to study Nursing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew coffee plants and buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a widow with three children. They live together at Nkronoma near Cape Coast. Ekua produces kenkey to sell. (Kenkey is an African dish made out of maize).  In the picture above, Ekua is getting her maize for her kenkey production. She has been in this business for some years now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey to sell. With the new profit,   Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kemkey to sell

loans.name: Gauranga

texts.en:
Gauranga is a 35-year-old physically disabled person living with his wife and two children who are in school. He runs a butcher shop in which he sells goat meat. He purchases goat kids, raises them and sells their meat in his butcher shops. It takes 8-9 months for him to raise and sell the goats. He goes out in the morning to take the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. He sells the meat in his shop in the evening. In this way, he is earning to control his cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage his daily activities.

He says that there is a lot of demand during the months of Apr-Jul and Oct-Dec, the auspicious time for Indian weddings. Currently he is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak demand times. He wants to take a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more goat kids and goats to seize the opportunity during this peak demand to sell more meat and to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and goat kids for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is from Ozamis in Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Arcely is a widow and has four children. 

To make a living, Arcely owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Arcely has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Arcely is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2009, Arcely joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Tiamparari

texts.en:
Tiamparari is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a dairy farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He is servicing his first loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase another dairy cow so as to increase the milk production. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Narmada

texts.en:
Narmada is a 28-year-old lady who lives with her in-laws and one child. She has eight years of experience in tailoring. She has one sewing machine with which she sews ladies garments like blouses, frocks and dresses for kids. From this business, she earns 9,500 INR per month, which is not enough for her family’s cash flow.
 
She has a plan to grow her business and do this activity on a large scale so that she can service the maximum number of customers. She wants to purchase two new sewing machines and some fabrics for her shop
.
She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase two more sewing machines to meet her customers’ demands and make them highly satisfied. She he also wants to hire some workers to her help in the business. She hopes to provide better education and study materials to her only child and take good care of her in-laws. She has a dream of living a happy life with her family members by fulfilling the family member’s requirements.

loans.use: to purchase two more sewing machines and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old and married with three children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory like snack foods, spices, egg, etc., to sell in her generals store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Myrna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her chidlren to college.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like snack foods, spices, egg, etc., to sell in her generals store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes and a sewing machine for their boutique business

loans.name: Macreña

texts.en:
Macrena is a 41 year old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

Macrena is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, hooks, and other items. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Macrena hopes to expand their business into a success and save money for the reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, hooks and other items

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 44-year-old business lady. She is a widow and has two children. She has been running a beauty salon for the past eleven years, with the monthly income of KES 21,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Ann will use the loan to buy beauty products and a hair dryer.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a hair dryer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, who is single, is 47 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helen owns and manages a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Helen is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. For the future, Helen's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase general store items like sugar, rice, tea, etc.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is from Panta-On, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has one child, and he is 24 years old. Noel plants and harvests corn to sell to earn a living, and he has been in this business for five years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP doing this kind of business. He requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Since 2010, Noel has been a member of GDMPC. Noel wants to build a house in the future, and to finish funding the education of his child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Marjorie is married and has one child. To make a living, Marjorie runs a general store. She has had this business for two years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Marjorie joined GDMPC. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and a mixed crop farmer married to Emma, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD credit officer. Robert will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to practice large-scale farming and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Zulafa's Group

texts.en:
Zulafa's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Zulafa is 19 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zulafa has been working hard to manage her small business; she sells fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Zulafa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more fresh fish for resale. The loan will help Zulafa to generate greater profits, which she will use to pay school fees for her child and her medical expenses. Zulafa hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for herself. 

Zulafa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 25 years old and single. She is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Joy grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for five years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. Joy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Joy joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a very hardworking person who is completely focused on her family's well-being. She is thirty years old and married with two sons. Mariam has been selling dumplings for two years. She makes dumplings every morning to provide a helping hand for her family. The business is located at home, which is beneficial because she can watch her children the entire time. Mariam is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking fat. With this loan, she will have the opportunity to improve her profits and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking powder, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, a 45-year-old married mother of three adult-aged and three school-aged children, lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Lolita sells a variety of snacks and viands. In business for 10 years, she earns approximately PHP 100 each week.

Having joined PMPC this year, she is requesting this loan to purchase additional ingredients for her enterprise. In the future, Lolita hopes to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her snack and viand vending business.

location.town: Ozamis-Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.ru: Нуруло берет повторный кредит в нашей организации. Он хочет купить необходимые запчасти для свой автомашины, чтобы заменить старые. Также Нуруло намерен провести капитальный ремонт в доме. Он надеется, что его поддержат.
texts.en: Nurulo is taking out a second loan from our organization.  He would like to buy necessary parts for his car, in order to replace the old parts.  Also, Nurulo would like to remodel his house.  He is hoping that he will be supported.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and repair his home

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married and has four children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business and earning an income from farming. His business has grown since he joined Faulu Kenya. 

He would like to expand his business and earn more profits. He requests a loan of 21,363.75 KES to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Mzuri

texts.en: Mzuri, 35, is a single woman with 6 children. She is very responsible and wants her children to have a good, stable life, so she works hard to provide for them. Mzuri works selling fish from her home, a business she has had for the last 3 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish, and that will visibly generate more income, which will be beneficial to her household.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 30-year-old father of five children. He lives in the Hatsashen village of the Aragatsotn region. Albert is engaged in agriculture. He keeps a cow, 30 sheep, and also has a plot of land where he cultivates wheat and barley. 

As it is very difficult to sustain such a big family, Albert wants to expand his farm. He needs some financial investments for which he has applied for the loan. With the requested amount, Albert will purchase forage for feeding the cattle during winter. 

As agriculture is the only source of income for this young family, it is very important for Albert to earn more income and cover the basic needs of his family. 

Albert and his wife dream to have a big farm and save money for the education of their children.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cattle during winter.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi produces kenkey, a staple food similar to bread or a dumpling, to sell. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family. Esi needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Esi will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 63-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She is the mother of two grown-up children. Martina has earned a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store for several years. She sells various goods to the people in her area.

Martina is asking for a loan to buy stock to resell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, snack food, chips and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock to resell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and other items.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Florita is married and has five children. Florita owns and operates a transportation service business. Florita has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 9,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC. Florita is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and a single-mother of a twelve-year-old child. She has been farming to earn a living. She also owns a bar. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to improve her business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya.

Rose hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 13,453.09 KES to buy a solar lamp. She will use the solar lamp to light her house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, 59, a resident of Malibay, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She operates her business, while at the same time she manages her household, together with her children. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelia owns and operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round, palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. Because rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that a person can buy, sometimes even from a peddler while riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Nelia is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy larger quantities of raw materials, like fabric and thread, to use in making rugs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nelia hopes to increase production, and dreams of being able to do her family good through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for larger quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread and other items, to use in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 47 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi District, East Georgia, with husband and son. Irma is also a librarian and gets monthly income. She requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 calves. Irma owns a bakery, where she bakes different kinds of rolls. It is hardly enough food for a three member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start-up her family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Irma will purchase a milk cow and feeds for the cattle. She also plans to expand her shed and her dairy business. After buying a milk cow, she will be able to produce more dairy products and sell it locally at a good price. It will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to expand her shed and purchase a milk cow and feeds for the cattle

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 47 years old, married and has seven children between 5 and 19 years old. He is known for selling local drinks. He has two years of experience and he works from 7 a.m until 7 p.m every day except on Sunday. 

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell. With this loan, he will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, he will continue improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto dice: “Me siento muy satisfecho de trabajar y producir siendo una persona de avanzada edad, gracias a l apoyo de los fondeadores de Kiva” Con su anterior credikiva, una vez mas logró comprar sintético y fabricó muchos forros para electrodomésticos que vendió muy pronto. Por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual hará reparaciones locativas a su vivienda y con ello continuará  mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rigoberto says: “I feel very satisfied that thanks to support from Kiva lenders I’m able to still work and be productive though I’m an older person.”  He used his previous Kiva loan to once again buy synthetic fabric he used to manufacture home appliance slipcovers that he quickly sold.  This is why he’s applying for a new Kiva loan that he’ll use to make some home improvements to continue improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Олимчон проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Олимчон занимается строительными работами по найму. В основном он проводит капитальный ремонт. 
Олимчон берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки и необходимых тканей для своей жены, чтобы она занялась шитьем, также чтобы начала свою деятельность на дому. Жена Олимчона имеет средне - специальное образование. Она портниха, но до сегодняшнего дня не работала по специальности.
texts.en:
Olimjon lives in Vahdat.  He is 43 years old.  He is married.  He has three children. Olimjon does construction work for hire.  He mostly remodels homes.  

Olimjon is taking out a loan to purchase a sewing machine and necessary fabrics for his wife, so that she can start sewing and also so that she can start her business at home. Olimjon's wife has a secondary vocational eduction.  She is a seamstress but until today has not worked in her profession.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric for his wife

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 21 years old and is married with one child. Claude sells various goods such as lotions, juice, rice, biscuits, clothes, etc. He has five years of experience in this work. 

Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, juice, rice, biscuits, clothes, etc., for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, juice, rice, biscuits, clothes, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a food vendor. She sells kenkey, a staple food similar to sourdough, and serves it with okra soup and fish in Cape Coast. Ama is married and has three children. She supports her partner in educating, feeding and clothing their children. Her loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall where she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama lives together with a husband who is a driver and 5 children at Akonma near Cape Coast. Ama  produces kenkey for sale (kenkey an African dish made out of maize).  Ama has been in this business for some time now. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the production of kenkey for sale. With the new profit, Ama plan to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize  for the production of kenkey (sourdough dumpling) for sale

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
Mwanamtama, 47, lives with her family in Msambweni which is in Coast Province. She considers herself to be a very cheerful person who enjoys her work and is very supportive of others.

She has had a small business selling fish from her home, a business she has been in for the last three years. The current loan, being her first with Yehu, is to buy more stock of fish and a weighing machine.

Her dream is to open a retail shop some day.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and a weighing machine.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 38 years old and a business man. He is married to Sarah, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been a taxi driver for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Alexander is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. He will use the loan to open a retail shop. 

He will educate his children with the anticipated profit from the two businesses. His hopes and dreams are to buy another car for hiring services and to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en: Tareq, a 37-year-old man, is a painter. He appears in the photo while he is painting. He is married and a father of one son and three daughters with ages between 1 and 5 years old. The income he gets is fair and enough to cover the family's needs, but his project needs more support to cover some of its costs. Tareq is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a collection of paints and some other required items such as special paint brushes and tools. Taking this loan will increase the quality of work and satisfy clients. This will increase Tareq's good reputation among customers, increase demand, and improve his income.

loans.use: To purchase paint, paint brushes, and other tools

loans.name: Onike's' Group

texts.en:
Onike's group is comprised of 6 hard working women. Onike is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Onike has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells flour, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Onike has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil to resell. This investment will help Onike to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Onike hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Onike is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more commodities like sodas, sugar, splash juice and cooking oil to resell.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a 24-years-old business man. He is married to Sarah and they currently have no children. He has been running a beauty salon for the past two years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the service by a credit officer. Meshack will use the loan to buy a hair dryer and hair products for his salon.
