He is very hard-working, and since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become very independent and has increased his profits.
 
He wishes to own a taxi for transportation services, and also to expand his business, in the future. He requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to purchase a license for his motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a license for his motorbike

loans.name: Maheswar

texts.en:
Maheswar is a 32-year-old physically challenged person living with his family in a small village in Odisha, India. His family consists of his wife; his one daughter, age 15; and one son, age 8. His wife is a homemaker and his children are continuing their schooling. He is the only earning person in his family. To support his family, he started a variety shop in the market which is two kilometres from his home. Whatever he earns from this activity is used for consumption purposes and is not sufficient for them to live happily and afford all necessities of life.

Maheswar sells packaged items like biscuits, cakes, wafers, chocolates, betel, etc., in his shop. He goes to the market to purchase the items for his shop very frequently. But, due to lack of funds, he is not able to meet the growing demand of his customers and compete with his competitors.

Maheswar has requested a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees (INR) to purchase stock of what he sells in bulk and purchase snacks like varieties of chocolates, wafers and bakery items for his shop. He needs to meet the market demands and compete with his competitors. He hopes to enlarge his business and construct a concrete house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing chocolates, wafers and bakery items for his shop.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 55 years old, married and a mother of three children.  She sells milk and porridge in Mpeketoni, Lamu for a living where she earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more milk from farmers.  In return, due to her sales, she will raise her status and the living standards of her family.  In doing so, she will be able to help educate her children. 

Lidia intends to continue growing her business and own a well established retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more milk from farmers.

loans.name: La  Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Italo  es uno de los miembros del grupo La Buena Amistad

Italo es soltero tiene 45 años, actualmente es el presidente del grupo y el único varón, son muchos años que participan juntos. Ítalo se dedica a la venta de pan, oficio que desempeña todos los días por las mañanas; repartiendo pan a sus caseras de diferentes zonas de su ciudad, con sus ahorros a logrado abrir otro negocio de venta de gas domestico, para ese fin se compro un puesto en el mercado de su zona, desde donde realiza la venta y el reparto de gas, sus clientes son los mismos comerciantes del mercado, amas de casa y restaurantes del lugar. Ítalo se siente feliz porque gracias a sus préstamos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo que le permite prosperar, con el dinero de su actual préstamo comprara más balones para su negocio, su mayor sueño en la vida es comprarse una casa propia y convertirse en un comerciante exitoso.
Italo agradece a todos los inversionistas que lo apoyan tanto a él como a su grupo comunal.

La Sra. que viste polo color morado aparece como invitada.
texts.en:
Italo is one of the members of the group, La Buena Amistad 

Italo is single and is 45 years old. Nowadays, he is the president of the group and the only male. They have participated together many years. Italo sells bread, a trade which he carries out every day in the mornings, distributing homemade bread to different areas of the city. With his savings, he has managed to open another business selling butane for household use. For this reason, he bought a stand in the market in his area from which he makes his sales and distribution of the butane.. His customers are the same market traders, housekeepers, and local restaurants. Italo feels happy because thanks to the loans, he has managed to increase his working capital that allows him to prosper. With the money from his current loan, he will purchase more butane tanks for his business. His greatest dream in life is to buy himself his own house and to turn into a successful trader. Italo is grateful to all the investors who support he and his communal group so much. 

The lady who is seen in the purple polo shirt appears as a guest.

loans.use: to purchase tanks of butane

loans.name: Kshirabdhi Tanaya

texts.en: Kshirabdhi Tanaya is a 30-year-old divorced woman living with her parents and a son, who is 4 years old. After her divorce with her husband, she came back to her paternal house and started living with her parents, but she felt like a burden on her parents as her father already has the responsibility of other family members. She planned to help her father financially and started out as a small entrepreneur. She makes badi (a traditional local food item prepared from lentils, spices, salt, pepper, etc.) She takes orders from her customers and they pick up these products from her house. She has been doing this activity manually. She earns 4,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for her family. Now, since she wants to grow her business, she requires a grinder and lentils and spices in bulk amounts. Kshirabdhi Tanaya says, “I can earn up to 6,000 INR per month after adding a grinder and raw materials for my business.” She has requested a loan of 25,000 INR for purchasing a mixer grinder and raw materials like lentils, spices, pepper, salt, etc., for her business. She wants to help her father and send her son to a good school.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a mixer grinder and raw materials like lentils, spices, pepper, salt, etc., for her badi business.

loans.name: Mikali

texts.en:
Mikali is a 38-year-old lady, is married and has two children, who are both in school. She has been selling fruits for four years and is also very hard-working. She has learned how to manage her business properly, with the help of Faulu Kenya.

She hopes to own a big grocery store, where she can operate her business and increase her profits, in the future. Now, she needs a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and watermelons.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and watermelons

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 22 years old. She is married and has no children. In 2008, she established her stationery shop. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW.

She is using her current loan to buy stationery goods for her business. 

Sabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family, in the future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy stationery and related goods.

loans.name: Kamalamani

texts.en:
Kamalamani is a 29-year-old divorced lady who lives in her parental house with her mother, younger brother and her daughter, age 8 years old. Three years back, her husband divorced her and then she came to her parental house. She does not want to be a burden on her family, so she started to sell rice in the village. Every day, the daily laborers are buying rice from her. In this way, she earns 3,500 Indian rupees (INR) per month. She has two years of experience in this business. This income is not enough for her family’s cash flow. She wants to grow her business and to purchase rice in bulk.

Kamalamani has requested a loan of 20,000 INR for purchasing rice in bulk so that she can grow her business and fulfill her customers' demands. She hopes to provide better education and study materials to her daughter and take good care of her parents. She can live a happy life with her family members and fulfill her family members' requirements.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 35 years old, married, and has five children, who are all in school. She has been in business for five years and also earns an income by farming. She is very hard-working, and with the help of Faulu Kenya her business has grown tremendously, and she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to own a big business one day. Now she requires a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions to resell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Al-Ahsan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ahsan. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Susan is a 28-year-old single woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER for home improvements. She would like to buy furniture for her bedroom. She hopes in the future to buy furniture for the rest of her house to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.en: Members of this group are very grateful to their Kiva lenders for the loans they have received. With the help of their just-repaid Kiva loan, these women were able to increase their business inventories. This led to an increase in sales and profit, and their living conditions improved a bit as a result of the improvements in their respective businesses. Having finished repaying that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each member of the group. With this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales, and further improve their living conditions. Featured leader Adama is going to use her share of this loan to buy shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, school bags, and womens’ clothing at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 49 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera desde hace muchos años pero tiene 4 hijos a quienes crió sola y con mucho esfuerzo, vive en su casa propia junto a su ultima hija de 15 años ya que los demás son independientes, sin embargo le brindan siempre el apoyo necesario para solventar los gastos de su hogar. La ocupación principal de nuestra amiga Rosa consiste en la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceites y algunos productos regionales como plátanos y verduras. Tiene una pequeña bodega que ha establecido en su casa y desde ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano. Todo lo que ofrece al público lo renueva a diario comprando en el mercado de la ciudad al por mayor, selecciona las verduras mas frescas y saludables. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hija la ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas diligencias fuera de casa. Lleva en esta actividad cerca de 1 año y le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos en su propia casa. 

Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque con los dividendos que obtiene de las ventas de sus productos puede solventar los gastos académicos de su hija y además puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, mas adelante espera extender su bodega para que pueda ofrecer más artículos y sus ganancias se incrementen. Este es el préstamo número 4 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, fideos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
49 year old Rosa is a good woman. She is kind and hardworking. She has been single for many years, but she has 4 children who she raised alone and with much strength. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter of 15 years, since the others are independents. However, they always offer the necessary support to afford the household expenses. The primary occupation of our friend Rosa consists in the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oils, and some regional products such as plantains and vegetables. She has a small shop which she has established in her house, and from there is open every day from early on. All that she offers to the public she renews daily, purchasing wholesale in the city marketplace. She selects the freshest and healthiest vegetables.  She works alone the majority of the time, but occasionally her daughter helps her when she has to do some errands outside of home. She has done this work for about a year and she likes the convenience and ease with which she is able to generate income in her own home.

She really likes what she does because the dividends that she obtains from the sale of her products, she is able to afford the academic expenses of her daughter and can also cover the basic necessities of her household. Later, she hopes to expand her small shop so that she is able to offer more items and her earnings will grow. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the loan opportunity that they offer to her, and for the financial backing that she needs to get ahead. She promises to pay her monthly payments punctually, and to continue working with great responsibility together with the members of her communal bank. 

With the requested loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase more staple products, such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, vegetables, and others.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Believe In God Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Believe In God II” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to ask for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each group member in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Abdul is the leader of this group. Abdul is 36 years old. He is married to a trader and has two children attending primary schools. Abdul sells cosmetics and has been doing business for six years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of cosmetics to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cosmetics to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells second hand clothes in Benyadze, near Elmina, which she has done for three years. She is married and has eight dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills. Abena needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will acquire a shop for selling her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Shamila

texts.es:
Shamila, de 28 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus menores hijos y su conviviente, ella trabaja mucho para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Shamila consiste en la venta de comida, el principal platillo que ofrece a su clientela es el “caldo de gallina”. Tiene un local en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad que colinda con el puerto pesquero y otras entidades públicas lo cual le permite tener gran cantidad de clientes que van en busca de los deliciosos y sustanciosos caldos como solo ella sabe preparar. Realiza esta actividad más de 2 años y le va muy bien. Por otra parte tiene un mototaxi que compró con ayuda de su conviviente y eso le genera un ingreso económico adicional. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo disponible por las tardes y estar tranquila en su casa a lado de sus hijos, además siente que le va muy bien ya que genera ingresos económicos por partida doble para su hogar, espera mas adelante tener un negocio en su casa relacionada al sector técnico vehicular para que trabaje junto a su cónyuge. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
El monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo utilizará para comprar algunos ingredientes e insumos como carne de gallina, fideos, papás, huevos, condimentos y otros, además comprará algunas ollas y utensilios que necesita para seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
28 year old Shamila is a good woman. She is kind and very responsible. She is married to her partner with whom she has three children of 8, 5, and 3 years of age. She has her own house, where she lives together with her 3 young children and her spouse. She works a lot to be able to offer a greater quality of life to her family. Shamila's work consists of food sales. The main dish that she offers her customers is "chicken soup" She has a stand in a busy street in the city that is adjacent to the fishing port and other public entities,  which permits her to have a great number of customers that go in search of the delicious and hearty soups, as only she knows how to prepare. She has done this work more than 2 years and it is going very well. Moreover, she has a mototaxi which she bought with the help of her spouse, and that generates an additional economic income. She really likes what she does since it allows her to have time available in the evenings and to be quiet in her house with her children. Additionally she feels that it is going very well since she generates economic income doubly for her household. She hopes later to have a business in her house related to the technical vehicular sector so that she can work together with her spouse. 

This is her 4th loan with MFP. It is for this that she is grateful to all the people who have made her loans possible to continue doing her work with the greatest results. Furthermore, she promises one more time to make the payments of her dues punctually, as she has in previous loans that she had. Additionally, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. 

The requested loan of 1000 soles will be used to purchase some ingredients and supplies, such as chicken meat, noodles, potatoes, eggs, condiments, and others. Otherwise she will purchase some pots and utensils that she needs to continue doing her work.

loans.use: to purchase chicken meat, noodles, potatoes, eggs, condiments, and others, as well as pots and utensils.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Meet Dominic: he runs a business in the mining town of Luanshya in the Copperbelt province of Zambia. He needs a Kiva loan. This is his story . . .

My name is Dominic. I am married, and I have two daughters. I grew up here in the small town of Luanshya, where I run my business of sending and receiving money. I also sell groceries.

When I first started, I used to sell a lot of different types of sweets in a makeshift stand locally known as a kantemba. I worked very hard, and it took me seven years to build my own shop in a proper building. However, things did not get any better because I did not have a lot of stock, and there was nothing to entice customers to my shop. In 2009, I started to run mobile money transfers through Zoona. My business improved because even though I did not have a lot of stock in my shop, people would come in to ask about money transfers. This gave me the foot traffic that I needed.

Now that many people have come to know my shop, the money that I have in my business is not enough to satisfy my customers. I am appealing to the Kiva lenders to help me out with this loan so that I can add it to my working capital and have the freedom to serve customers who want to send and receive money at all times.

loans.use: add to his capital so he can serve more people who want to send and receive money.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 24 years old and a business man who owns a cyber cafe.  He has been in business for three years.  He is a very responsible and hardworking gentleman.  Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, Eric has learned how to save his money.  This has helped him to invest more in his business.
He wishes to grow and expand his business and for this reason, he requests a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy furniture and a back-up power supply.

loans.use: to buy furniture and to buy power back-up.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a food vender. She cooks plain rice and vegetable stew for sale. She has done this for three years. She lives together with her husband and two children at Benyadze near Cape Coast. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Nana will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare her food to sell

loans.name: Akosoua

texts.en: Akosoua produces kenkey for sale at Benyadze near Elmiina. She has been selling kenkey for some years. She is a single parent with four children. As a single parent Akosoua uses her income to pay for the school fees and the general upkeep of her children. She needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production. With the new profit, Akosoua wish to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres al Poder”  en el Séptimo Ciclo  con 17   integrantes, cada una de las miembros tiene su propio trabajo, pero también ayuda a sus demás compañeras para poder fomentar la unión, y que todas sigan luchando por sus sueños.
Una de estas 17 mujeres es María, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Maria cuenta que su negocio está creciendo gracias al trabajo que ella está haciendo y gracias a la ayuda de su grupo. Tiene mayores ventas los fines de semanas, y se está preparando para estas fiestas, ya que quiere poder tener bien surtido su negocio, y es por eso que solicita del crédito, `para la compra de gaseosas, vinos, whiskys, cervezas y demás, y así poder tener un gran stock.
Ellas agradecen por la ayuda que reciben, pues sus familias también están siendo beneficiadas y están saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Mujeres al Poder Communal Bank is in its seventh cycle with 17 members.  Each one of them has her own job but also helps her other colleagues to promote unity and to continue fighting for their dreams.

María is one of these 17 women.  She makes a living selling all types of beverages.  María says her business is growing thanks to the work she's doing and to the help of her bank.  She has bigger sales on the weekend, and she's getting ready for the coming holidays because she wants to be able to have her business well stocked.

This is why she's requesting the loan to buy soda, wine, whisky, beer, and other beverages, so she can have a large supply.

They're grateful for the help they receive because their families also are being benefitted and are getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy soda, wine, whisky, beer, and other beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace who is now 33 years old, used her previous loan to buy a motorbike.  Her business did very well and she successfully repaid her loan.  She has learned how to save money through the help of Faulu Kenya.  She is also a tailor and designs dresses, shorts, coats and bed sheets.
She hopes to purchase a car, land and also have a fleet of motor bikes.  Grace requires a loan of 84,442.50 to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Go Befo Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Go Befo” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 Leones (for each person) in order to invest in their businesses. This is the third loan that this group of entrepreneurs are accessing from Kiva lenders through SMT. With the help of the previous Kiva lenders' loan, they were able to increase their business inventories, make better profits and improve their living conditions. Having completed repayment of their last loan successfully, two members out of the five in the group would like to get a new loan, in order to further improve their businesses.  

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. Kadiatu is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, who are attending secondary schools. Kadiatu sells cooked rice with delicious sauce, and has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients, like uncooked rice, palm-oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, onions, and ground nuts, in bulk. With these bulk items at hand, she will stop buying them at retail prices and will be able to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her prepared food business, like uncooked rice and palm-oil, in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 32 years old and a business lady who operates a grocery store.  She is married and has been in business for over five years.  She is very hardworking.  Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has increased her profits.  Sarah gives thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her on business management skills.  She hopes to someday expand her business and therefore requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en: Minu is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 15.  In 2000, she established her pickle making business.  Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business.   In the future, Minu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her pickle making business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale. Ekua has been selling fried fish for 8 years now. She is married with 6  dependents. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. Ekua will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale. Ekua will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
San Juan II,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que  la presidenta  contacto con la asesora durante otra reunión que esta tenía por la zona.
Edit, la presidenta, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que hace, pues tiene gran habilidad para las comidas. Su meta es poder tener un local grande donde poder seguir vendiendo sus productos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, aderezos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y deleitando a sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Juan II is the name of the excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita, thanks to the president contacting the adviser during another meeting the adviser had in the area.  
Edit, the president, sells fast food. She comments that she has a very good clientele that always purchases the delicacies that she makes because she has great expertise in food. Her goal is to be able to have a large shop where she is able to continue selling her products. 
She requests this loan to purchase vegetables, condiments, dressing, and other items to be able to continue making her foods and delighting her customers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, condiments, dressings, and other items.

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en:
Maame Efua cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) for sale. She serves the banku with fish and vegetable sauce in Benyadze near Elmina.  

Maame is married to a farmer and has eight dependents. Maame has done this business for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the banku business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for the banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) business.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
En el 5to ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras esta el grupo Sagrado Corazón de Jesús, ellas empezaron con el propósito de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio de su trabajo. Nora es parte de este grupo, y se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Nora está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo, y quiere poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a las personas que necesitan de ella. La meta de Nora es poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de prendas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas y demás prendas para poder surtirse y tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: In their 5th cycle of the program of entrepreneurial women, this the group Sagrado Corazón de Jesús. They started in order to help each other through their work. Nora is part of this group and she sells clothing. Nora is getting ahead and helps her family through her work and wants to continue growing and helping the people that need her. Nora's goal is to be able to have a store where she is able to offer her clients a good variety of clothes. She requests the loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothes to be able to stock up and to have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothes.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El comité "Los Angeles” está en su tercer ciclo. Este grupo surgió por el contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Ellas se ayudan en todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante e ir creciendo en todo lo que hacen.
Alicia, una de las integrantes de este grupo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo. Ella es una muy buena vendedora y gracias a eso está saliendo adelante y le está yendo bien.  Alicia está contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que les está siendo de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar cosméticos y así seguir dando productos de gran calidad a sus clientas.
texts.en:
The communal group "Los Angeles" is in their third cycle. This group emerged because of the contact of one of the members with the foundation. They help in all that they need in order to get ahead and to continue growing in all that they do.
Alicia, one of the members of this group sells cosmetics of all types. She is a very good saleswoman and thanks to that she is getting ahead and is doing well. Alicia is happy to form part of the group since it is of much help to them. 
She requests this loan to be able to purchase cosmetics and therefore continue giving good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Rincon De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité RINCON DE LA ESPERANZA  es un grupo antiguo que tras los años va fortaleciéndose y luchando contra las dificultades que conlleva sacar adelante el grupo son sras muy luchadoras y responsables, trabajadoras incansables.
Crecencia, una de las miembros vende lencería, y cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, pues tiene lencerías muy buenas y a muy buen precio. Ella tiene muy buena habilidad para las ventas y así, sumado a su esfuerzo se está abriendo camino. Es una persona con grandes ansias de crecer y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lencerías, tanto para hombres como para mujeres y así seguir dando buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: The women of the communal bank RINCON DE LA ESPERANZA are an old group that continues growing stronger through the years and fighting against the difficulties that moving ahead entails. The members of the group are fighters and very responsible, hardworking, and tireless. Crecencia, one of the members, sells lingerie, and says that she has had very good clientele, as she has very good lingerie at a very good price. She has great ability for sales, and so, plus her effort, is making her way. She is a person with great desires to grow and to help her family through her work. She requests this loan to purchase lingerie, both for me nad for women, and therefor continue giving good quality to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie for sale.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua operates a grocery shop. She is married to a farmer and has five children. They live together near Beneyase Elmina. Akosua has been operating this grocery shop for some years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Akosua needs this loan to enable her get a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to get a variety of grocery items to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ishmeal

texts.en:
Ishmeal is a food vender. She cooks plain rice and vegetable stew  for sale. This she has done this for three years. She lives together with her husband and two children at Aburansa, near Elmina.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.    

Ishmeal will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare for selling. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients to prepare for selling.

loans.name: Jagabandhu

texts.en:
Jagabandhu is a 24-year-old physically challenged person living with his father, wife, four younger brothers aged 22, 20, 17 and 15, and one son aged 1 1/2  years old. He started a cycle repair center three years ago to support his family. His father is engaged in farming and two of his younger brothers are involved in daily labor. Whatever they earn from these activities is used for consumption purposes and is not sufficient for them to live happily and afford all tnecessities of life.

He has to go very frequently to market to purchase bicycle spare parts. Because he lacks finances, he is not able to purchase the spare parts in bulk. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to reconstruct his shop and purchase spare parts like freewheels, tires, tubes etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like freewheels, tires, tubes etc. for his cycle repair shop.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operate the grocery shop in the picture above. She sells items like tissue paper, sanitary towels, diapers, powered milk, toffee, biscuits, and other items at Aburansa near Elmina. She is married and has five children. Esi has been in this business for some years now. She uses her income to assist the husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy grocery items like milk, powered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish and other items to satisfy her customers .She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy milk, powered milk, canned tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Surendra

texts.en:
Surendra is a 30-year-old physically disabled person living with his wife and one child, in the small village of Puri in Odisha, India. He is engaged in doing carpentry. He takes orders from his customers for making doors, chairs, tables etc. He earns 8,000 INR per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for his family to survive.
 
He wants to enlarge his business by taking orders in bulk from his customers and fulfilling their demands on time. He wants to purchase new and advanced tools for making furniture and wooden logs to prepare ready-made furniture like small tables, coffee tables etc.

He has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR for purchasing the above items. He says that by doing so, his monthly income will increase and he will be able to give his family a good standard of living.
.
He has a dream of having his child study in a good school and saving some money for his family’s bright future.

loans.use:
to purchase tools and wooden logs for making furniture
.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Eddie is 33 years old. He runs a small business in his hometown of Chililabombwe, a town whose main economic activity is the mining of copper. He is very happy for the opportunity to get his very first loan.

Eddie’s business deals in the supply of stationary materials, small computer accessories and relish. He also offers the services of mobile money transfers, photocopying and typing. He says most of his profits come from his mobile money transfers business.

Eddie started running his business three years ago. He does not have a building structure, but used his initiative to come up with a makeshift small shop that he uses to make his transactions.  Most of Eddie’s customers are miners who send money to their families back home.

Eddie is very excited to get his first loan because it will help him to have some good working capital. Having more capital will boost Eddie’s business, as he will be able to serve more customers who want to send money at his shop.

He has hopes of seeing his business grow to greater heights. Someday, he would like to move to a shop with a proper building structure.

In the video, a representative from Zoona interviews Eddie.

loans.use: To increase the money he has available to make transfers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married with two children. She sells African print cloth and fabrics at Elmina, which she has done for some years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed, and clothe her children and pay school fees. Abena will use her loan to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more African print cloth and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 4 and 18, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past 3 years, Oretha has been selling dry fish in the local market. She enjoys the way her customers buy her dry fish. She learned this way of selling from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. Her profits are used on school fees and food, and she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Gaydu

texts.en:
Gaydu 35, who lives at West Point, is a single parent with four children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 17 and are currently in school. She has been working very hard in managing her business for the past nine years, since she is the only source of income for her children.

Gadyu has a table where she sells flour, cooking oil, sugar, butter, eggs, black pepper, milk and baking powder. Some difficulties she faces is the low sales during the rainy season. She makes profits when she sells because of her good interaction with her customers. She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to  purchase more flour, sugar, butter, eggs, milk for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, eggs, milk for the business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu, 45, lives at West Point with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 7 and 23 and are currently in school. Bendu has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) for the past 15 years. She makes profit when she sells because she always prepares her customers' favorite dishes. She sells six days a week. She prepares fufu [starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice] with soup, cassava leaves and potato grains to meet her customers' demands. 

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her cook shop.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa sells vegetables such as  garden eggs (eggplants), peppers and tomatoes at Aburansa Market near Cape Coast. She has been selling vegetables for 14 years now. She uses her income in the general upkeep of her home. Adwoa will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs and peppers to sell. With the new profit, she wishes to mount a stall for selling her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplants) and peppers for resale.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Divino Niño Jesús es de la ciudad de Carapeguá.  Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 9º ciclo con 17 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar. Se dedican exclusivamente cada una en sus respectivas actividades con deseo de incrementar sus ganancias y poder de esa manera ganarse el pan de cada dia de ellas y sus familias.
La Sra. Roly, una de las miembros de este grupo, se dedica a la venta ambulante, su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que llueva o no tiene que salir a trabajar en busca del bienestar de su familia. Es muy loable todo lo que hace, pues quiere que su familia tenga todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sabanas, edredones, frazadas y demás productos para poder seguir vendiendo.
Su sueño es que el día de mañana ya no tenga que hacer su trabajo en forma ambulante y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño Jesús" committee is from the city of Carapeguá. The committee is now in its ninth cycle. It is composed of seventeen members; hardworking women that strive to get ahead in life. Each has her own activity, and they all want to increase their profits and in that way to be able to bring food to their families’ tables.

Mrs. Roly, one of the group’s members, is a street vendor. This job requires a lot of sacrifice, since she has to work regardless of the weather in order to provide for her family. Everything she does is admirable, because she wants her family to have everything she could not have as a child.

Mrs. Roly is requesting this loan to buy sheets, quilts, blankets and other products to sell. Her dream is to have her own establishment in the future, so that she does not have to work in the streets.

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts, blankets and other products.

loans.name: Daniel  Kwesi

texts.en: Daniel is a farmer. He harvests and cultivates plantains for sale at Aburansa. He has been a farmer for 10 years now. Daniel is married with 2 children. He uses his income to feed and clothe his children, and to pay their school fees. Daniel will use his loan to hire labour to help him work on his farm and also to purchase machines and fertilizers to enable him to cultivate more plantains. He will expand his farm with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase machines and fertilizers to enable him to cultivate more plantains.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a petty trader. She sells diapers, sanitary towels, panties, ladies wear, children's dresses, children's toys and other items in Abura. She has been in this business for some years now. Adjoa is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. She needs this loan to enable her to purchase more items such as diapers, sanitary towels and dresses for ladies and children, for the purpose of reselling. With the new profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as diapers, sanitary towels and dresses for ladies and children in order to resell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) in Abura. She has done this for some years now.  The foods she serves are fufu (a starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that is eaten with soup or stew), banku (a dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and rice balls. She is married with 3 children.

Diana uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase foodstuffs and other ingredient to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Diana plans to get a better place to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and other ingredient to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is a petty trader. He sells woolen and rubber carpets in Abura, which he has done for some years now. He is married with 5 children. He uses his income to pay his children’s school fees.

Kwaku want to increase sales, so a loan from Kiva will enable him to acquire a variety of woolen and rubber carpets to sell. With the new profit, he will give his children the best education.

loans.use: to acquire a variety of woolen and rubber carpets to sell

loans.name: Flomena Jepkoech

texts.en:
Flomena, a forty-three-year-old lady, is married to Julius and blessed with four children aged 24, 22, 18 and 16 years. Her husband is a carpenter, while Flomena operates a green grocery stall. 


She has been in this business for twelve years now and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She has requested for a second loan of KES. 60,000 to pay fees for her child in college.

In the future she wants to open a wholesale shop as well as educate her children.

loans.use: to pay fees for her child in college.

loans.name: Kilisho

texts.en:
Kilisho is 27 years old, married and blessed with four children that he supports. He has operated a motorbike transport business for the last five years, making a monthly income of KES. 13,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 86,300 from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy a new motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used to educate his children. 

His future plans is to improve his family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and a mixed crop farmer married to Jane, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to practice large-scale farming and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara cooks kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) for sale at Elmina. She is divorced and has 5 children. Hajara has been selling kenkey for 15 years now.  She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills.

Hajara will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of her kenkey to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama produces fanti kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) for sale in Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She is a single parent and has 8 dependents. Ama has been selling fanti kenkey for 10 years now. She uses her income to pay their children's school fees.

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a fish monger in Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She buys fresh fish and smokes it for sale. Aba has been into this business for 10 years now. She is married to a driver and has 2 children. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills.

She will use her loan to purchase large quantities of fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profit, Aba wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married to a mason and has 3 children. She sells waakye, which is rice and beans cooked together. She serves it with gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava)	, macaroni, meat and fish stew. Salamatu has been selling waakye for 11 years now.  She uses her income to support  her husband to pay their children’s school fees.

Salamatu needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye to sell. With the new profit, Salamatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye (rice and beans) to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a carpenter who makes furniture and other items for sale.  He has done this for some years now.  He uses his income to provide food, clothes and shelter for his family.

Peter will use his loan to purchase wood, machines and other materials for his work. With the new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood, machines and other materials for his work

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa significa mujer trabajadora, y eso es lo que son estas 16 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, quienes se unieron y hasta hoy trabajan arduamente y ya están en el noveno ciclo.
Gasparina es un ejemplo de trabajo, ella tiene una despensa, en la que trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta ya muy noche. Su negocio al principio fue muy pequeño, pero de a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo lo fue reforzando y hoy en día ya es bastante concurrido.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtirlo, y así seguir dando calidad y variedad a sus clientes. Quiere poder comprar verduras, hortalizas, carnes y demás artículos de primera necesidad para ofrecer todo eso a sus clientes.
Todas las miembros de este grupo están contentas con el programa y quieren seguir creciendo con el.
texts.en:
'Kuña Guapa' means 'hard-working woman' and that is what these 16 women from the city of Caaguazú are.  They joined together as a group and have been working hard together.  They are now in their ninth loan cycle.

Gasparina is an example of this work.  She has a grocery store in which she works from very early in the morning until very late at night.  At first, her business was very small but she gradually worked hard to strengthen it and now it is quite busy.

Gasparina is requesting this loan so that she can stock her business and thereby continue providing her customers with good quality and variety.  She would like to be able to buy greens, veg, meat and other basic household products so that she can offer them all to her customers.

All the members of this group are happy with the program and would like to continue growing with it.

loans.use: to buy greens, veg, meat and other supplies

loans.name: Karanday Poty Group

texts.es:
Karanday Poty surgió con la intención de una de las miembros, de querer ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas y por medio del trabajo y la unión de todas salir adelante, ya que es la mejor forma de poder crecer.
La Sra. Isabel, una de estas mujeres, se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene un pequeño copetín bien surtido, donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Gracias a su amabilidad y buenos precios se esta haciendo de muy buena clientela, y gracias a esto tiene los medios para poder seguir manteniendo a su familia y ayudándolos.
Solicita de esta ayuda para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, carnes, verduras y demás. Ella al igual que su grupo agradece por la oportunidad de trabajar juntas y recibir las capacitaciones que les dan.
texts.en:
The 'Karanday Poty' group was formed as one of its members wanted to help her friends and neighbors so that, through their work and unity, they could make progress, as this is the best way to grow.

Isabel, one of these women, has a small, well-stocked snack bar where she sells all kinds of products such as food, drinks, candies, etc.  Thanks to her friendliness and her good prices, she is building up a very good customer base and, as a result, she is able to continue supporting and helping her family.

Isabel is requesting this help in order to buy drinks, candies, meat, vegetables, etc.  She and her group are grateful for the opportunity they have to work together and receive training.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candies, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is an aged thirty-four farmer, in Litein county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children. The children are attending school. Geofrey has been in farming for the past ten years producing tea and milk which he sells to the people around his local area. As well, he buys and sells processed tea as an additional source of income.

He is requesting 60,000 KES (Kenyan shilling) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a green house which will help in increasing his tea production and will improve his livelihood and also help him in paying for his children's school fees.

Geofrey aspires to be buying and selling tea in bulk in the next five years.

Competition, and transportation are his main challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a green house

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en:
Jennet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She has 3 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Jennet has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which puts some clothes on the market. 

To help expand her business, Jennet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to bay for more clothes and will help Jennet to generate greater profits and build houses for rental. Jennet hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger store. 

Jennet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 33 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Augustine has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells alcohol and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Augustine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like lemonade and beer for his bar, helping Augustine to generate greater profits, which he will use to send his children to school. Augustine hopes that in the future he will be able to add to the business. 

Augustine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Augustine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as lemonade and beer, for his bar.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo,  siempre saben salir adelante, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 10º, tienen ahorros y caja chica que les facilitan ante cualquier imprevisto.
La Sra. Irene es la tesorera del grupo, y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto , ella tiene venta de articulos de limpieza y realiza todo tipo para cosas en el hogar etc. Irene cuenta que con el correr del tiempo y con la ayuda de su trabajo y de su grupo quiere poder tener su propio local de artículos de limpieza. Y en miras a seguir trabajando para estar cada vez más cerca de sus sueños es que solicita este crédito, para la compra de productos de limpieza para poder venderlos y seguir tendiendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank is very active. They always know how to move forward. The group is in its tenth cycle. They have savings and petty cash that helps with any unexpected expenses. 
Irene is the treasurer of the group and she always knows how to work well in her position. She sells cleaning supplies and she does different things in the house. Irene realized that with the passage of time and with help from her work and they group, she wants to have her own cleaning supplies business. Since continuing to work  helps her come closer to her dreams, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase cleaning supplies to sell them and to have income to help her family.

loans.use: purchase cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Mujeres Unidas, son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy contentas de formar este grupo, ya que saben que tendrán la oportunidad de crecer y trabajar para poder ayudar a sus familias y procurarles una vida digna.
La presidenta, la señora Sara vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la cría de pollos. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas. Sara y su marido se ayudan para poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien, ya que ellos son su mayor tesoro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, para poder venderlos y tener un buen stock de buenos productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women from the 'Mujeres Unidas' committee are very hard-working people.  They are very happy to belong to this group as they know that they will have the opportunity to work and grow so that they can help their families and provide them with a decent life.

The president of the group, Sara, lives with her husband and children.  Her business is raising chickens.  She and her fellow group members constantly carry out activities and thereby encourage group integration and try to bring forward their repayments.  Sara and her husband help each other so that they can provide their children with a good education and ensure they become upstanding citizens in the future as they are their greatest treasure.

Sara is requesting this loan to buy chickens so that she can sell them and have a good stock of good-quality products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. In the past, Frank has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells maize, beans and groundnuts. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to renovate the store and stock more goods such as maize flour, beans and groundnuts, and will help Frank to generate greater profits and boost his sales which will lead to bigger profits. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to have a wide variety of groceries that meet all his customers' needs. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to renovate the store and stock more goods such as maize flour, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Maud

texts.en:
Maud is 39 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She has 5 children,3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Maud has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and kitchen wares. 

To help expand her business, Maud has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for the business, such us sugar and all types of flour, helping Maud to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. Maud hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children up to university. 

Maud is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Maud who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her business, such us sugar and all types of flour.

loans.name: Furahini Group

texts.fr: La présidente  Bahati est une femme ambitieuse de l’association d’affaire  Furahini. Elle  est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Etant au 7eme cycle de credit chez Hekima, elle sollicite ce credit pour l’achat d’une camionnette pour lui faciliter la livraison des planches qui constitue son activité principale.  Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien.
texts.en: Bahati, the president, is an ambitious woman in the business group Furahini. She is married and the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school. She is on her 7th loan cycle with Hekimi and is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase a van to facilitate delivery of boards, which is her primary business activity. She thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a van

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.fr: Mulangala est une commerçante ambitieuse. Trésorière de l’association Ulezi, mariée et mère de 8enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des laits concentrés spécialités  africaines dans le grand marché central de Bukavu depuis sa jeunesse. Elle sollicite ce credit pour se ravitailler en 50 kilos de laits. Elle prie Dieu de bénir Hekima et le remercie.
texts.en: Mulangala is an ambitious businesswoman. She is the treasurer of the group Ulezi, married and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She has been in the business of selling African specialty concentrated milk in the large central market of Bukavu since her childhood. Mulungala is requesting this loan in order to be able to replenish her stock with 50 kilos of milk. She prays that God bless Hekima and thanks him.

loans.use: to purchase 50 kilos of milk

loans.name: Mujembere Group

texts.fr: Bahati est femme entrepreneur de l’association de credit  Mujembere. Mère de 5 enfants  tous scolarisés; est agée de 35 ans. Vendeuse des pagnes africains, elle sollicite ce credit pour constituer sa provision  des 50 pièces. Elle souhaite  la croissance de ses activités et l’achat d’une maison d’habitation. Elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en: Bahati is a female entrepreneur with the loan group Mujembere. She is the mother of 5 children, all of whom attend school, and is 35 years old. Bahati, a seller of African wrap cloths, is requesting this loan in order to be able to stock herself up with 50 pieces of the cloth. She hopes for the growth of her business and to one day be able to buy a home. She thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pieces of cloth

loans.name: Tudumu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Namudumbi est présidente de l’association d’affaire Tudumu. Elle est mariée à un cultivateur, mère de 10 enfants tous scolarisés à 48ans. Elle demande ce credit pour s’approvisionner  en 20 bidons vides et 10 chaises traditionnelles pour le revendre. Son souci est de construire sa propre maison d’habitation au travers le bénéfice de ce credit et ainsi elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Namudumbi is the president of the business group Tudumu. She is married to a farmer, the mother of 10 children all of whom attend school, and is 48 years old.

Namudumbi is requesting this loan to be able to purchase 20 empty barrels and 10 traditional chairs in order to resell them. Her main concern is building her own home through the profit enabled by this loan, and so she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 20 empty barrels and 10 traditional chairs

loans.name: Utaratibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Machozi est trésorière du groupe Utaratibu.  Agée de 43 ans est mariée à un homme d’affaire et mère  de 8 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés depuis sa jeunesse. elle sollicite ce credit pour lui permettre de s’approvisionnement  en 6 sacs des poissons salés. L’obstacle majeur qu’elle connait régulièrement c’est la rareté de sa marchandise. Elle bénie Hekima et souhaite  devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Machozi is the treasurer of the group Utaratibu. She is 43 years old, married to a businessman, and the mother of 8 children, all of whom attend school. She has been in the business of selling salted fish since her childhood. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to replenish her stock with 6 bags of salted fish. 

The major obstacle that she faces regularly is the scarcity of her merchandise. She thanks Hekima and hopes to one day become a wholesaler.

loans.use: purchase 6 bags of salted fish

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando, es antiguo cliente de la fundación, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá es soltero y se dedica a la venta de Gaseosa de la Costa en la Ciudad de Quiindy.
El es una persona con ganas de salir adelante y progresar, es por ello que se esfuerza siempre por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan, su sueño es poder tener un gran local y es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para comprar más gaseosas, y así seguir trabajando por sus sueños.
Agradece por la oportunidad que nuevamente le da la fundación, ya que quiere seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Fernando is a long-standing client of Fundación Paraguaya.  He is single and lives in his parents' home in the city of Carapeguá.  His business is selling De la Costa sodas in the city of Quiindy.

Fernando is a person who has a desire to make progress and get ahead in life.  He always works hard so that he can provide his family with everything they need.  His dream is to have large business premises. He is requesting this loan to buy more soda so that he can continue working towards his dreams.  He is grateful for the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya is giving him once again as he would like to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy soda to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La Sra. Ninfa tiene 38 años,  está casada con el Sr. Luciano hace 22 años,  tienen 3 hijos juntos, y quienes son el motivo de lucha de la pareja.
La Sra. Ninfa es Peluquera de profesión hace ya 23 años, trabajó mucho tiempo por Asunción, ella es oriunda de San José de los Arroyos de donde vino hace 8 años. Montó su Salón de Peluquería primeramente en su casa, ahora ya tiene otro salón en el Centro de la ciudad. Su trabajo es de mucho sacrificio ya que también tiene que cuidar la crianza y educación de sus hijos, comenta que su trabajo es muy cansador pero gratificante, además dice que su ramo tiene mucha competencia y a veces desleal.  Ahora está creciendo y tiene venta de  lencería y ropas para dama,  para satisfacer aun más las necesidades de sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bluzas, pantalones, camisas, para poder expandirse en este nuevo ramo.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 38 years old and has been married to Luciano for 22 years.  The couple have three children who motivate them to work hard.

Ninfa is a hairdresser by profession and has been working in this field for 23 years.  She worked for a long time in Asunción.  She is originally from San José de los Arroyos but moved eight years ago.  She first set up her hairdressing salon in her own home but she now has another salon in the city center.  Her work is very demanding as she also has to raise and educate her children.  She says that her work is very tiring but also gratifying.  She also says that there is a lot of competition in her business and often disloyalty.  Ninfa is growing her business and also sells ladies' clothing and underwear so that she can further meet the needs of her customers.

Ninfa is requesting this loan to buy blouses, pants and shirts so that she can expand in this new field.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elisa de 66 años de edad, está felizmente casada con el Sr. Juan  de 69 años de edad, tienen la dicha de tener 7 hijos ya todos mayores de edad.
La Sra. Elisa  se dedica al comercio hace más de 20 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida. Empezaron dicho negocio con el ahorro con que contaban con su esposo y de a poco fueron fortaleciendo su negocio día a día y que en la actualidad es el sustento de la familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, etc. ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos.  La Sra. Elisa tiene como anhelo de que su negocio vaya prosperando como lo viene haciendo para que les brinde una vida digna.
texts.en:
Elisa is 66 years old and happily married to 69-year-old Juan.  The couple have been blessed with seven children who are all now adults.

Elisa has been working in commerce for more than 20 years.  She has a well-stocked grocery store.  She started this business with some savings that she and her husband had and they have gradually been strengthening the business.  It is currently their family's means of support.

Elisa is requesting this loan to buy drinks, candies, etc. as she has very good demand for these products.  Elisa hopes that her business will continue to prosper, as it has done up to now, so that she can provide her family with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy drinks and candies

loans.name: Matendo Group

texts.fr: Tulinabo est présidente du groupe Matendo. Agée de 31ans, femme vivant seul est mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés.  Ce prêt sollicité, va l’aider  à acheter 7 ballons de souliers usagés. Son rêve est  d’avoir son propre dépôt de stockage pour la vente en gros et une bonne survie de ses enfants. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en:
Tulinabo is the president of the group Matendo. 31 years old, she is a single mother of 2 children, both of whom attend school. The loan that she has requested will help her to purchase 7 bags of used shoes. 

Tulinabo's dream is to have her own warehouse of stock to be able to sell wholesale, and to ensure a good life for her children. She therefore thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to purchase 7 bags of used shoes

loans.name: Utaratibu2 Group

texts.fr: Kabesha est membre de l’association d’affaire  Utaratibu 2. Agée de 32 ans est mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un homme sans emploi. Le credit sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 6300 œufs qu’elle pourra revendre. Elle remercie Hekima de l’avoir soutenu.
texts.en: Kabesha is a member of the business group Utaratibu 2. She is 32 years old, the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school, and married to an unemployed man. The loan she has requested will allow her to purchase 6300 eggs which she will be able to resell. She thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase 6300 eggs

loans.name: Laboin

texts.en:
Laboin, a 26-year- married father of one, lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past year, Laboin has been working hard to manage his grocery store which sells beans, maize and groundnuts.

To help expand his business, Laboin has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items such as flour, sorghum and millet for the business. This will help him generate greater profits and increase the family's income. He hopes to expand his enterprise in the future.

Laboin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Laboin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more items like flour, sorghum and millet for the business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is from the village of Tinago in Ozamiz City in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Letecia is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase another transport vehicle for the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase an additional vehicle for her transport business.

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Leni's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 41 years old and married.  Adela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Adela requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

She has been raising livestock for three years, and she has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Oyuntogtokh

texts.en:
Oyuntogtokh is 54 years old. She has operated a retail business since 1996 at Kharhorin market, the second largest market in the city. She purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Oyuntogtokh is living with her invalid daughter and her son’s family on her plot of land. She and her son have been building a new house on the land and the house is 60% complete. 

The loan that Oyuntogtokh is taking out will be used to complete building her new house. By doing this, she can build an energy-saving house which has less initial heat loss. Smoke from charcoal-burning stoves generates harmful chemicals and dust into the atmosphere. The Mongolian government is taking regulatory steps to stop charcoal burning or to at least minimize its use to appropriate amounts, but charcoal is becoming widespread as the fuel used due to its cheap price.

loans.use: to complete building her new house

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
This is Rhodora, a 43-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, who is married to Jimmy, a seaman, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rhodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rhodora is requesting a Php12,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Rhodora hopes to further expand, and dreams of giving her children a good quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, aged 64, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and, together with her children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Loreta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Loreta's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Loreta is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Loreta hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and  she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Duero, Bohol. She owns a motorcycle locally known as "habal-habal". Some of her neighbors rent her motorcycle for transportation purposes.

Teofila wants to apply for a loan to buy fuel and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle. In this way, she will be able to maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle.
