loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 39 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. She is engaged in lumber cutting and selling and earns approximately PHP12,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. She has requested a loan to be used in paying for labor and other expenses in cutting lumber for her existing business. In the future, Elvie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in paying for labor and other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is separated with 3 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. To earn a living, she has a sari-sari (variety) store. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8,000. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. In the future, Ethel hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to add capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Frainer

texts.es:
Frainer es un joven de 29 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de legumbres, labor que le ha permitido sostenerse en la ciudad y ofrecerse la oportunidad que las circunstancias le habían negado; estudiar, deseando ser un gran administrador de su pequeña empresa idealizándola en el corto plazo como un gran mercado de legumbres y carnes.

Este joven sueña con incrementar su línea de productos ofertados en el mercado y por eso a recurrido a la aprobación de un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de pollo y pescado para ofrecerles a sus clientes en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Frainer is a young man of 29 and he sells vegetables, a job that has allowed him to sustain himself in the city and to offer the opportunities that circumstances have denied him in the past: to study. He wants to be an administrator of his small business and to make it into a large market for vegetables and meats. 

This young man wishes to expand his line of products that he offers at the market and to do this he is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of chicken and fish so he can offer these items to his customers this Christmas.

loans.use: purchase chicken and fish for his business.

loans.name: Aljack

texts.en:
Aljack, a 34-year-old, is a married entrepreneur in San Vicente, Bajo, Oroquieta. She has 2 children and is earning from her transport service business. It was started almost 2 years ago and she earns about 6,000 PHP a month. 

To improve her business, she is borrowing the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which she just joined in 2011, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Fe is in the processed meat business. She makes processed meat ranging from sausages embutido (pork roll), processed pork and other similar products. She also sells garlic and onions. Fe's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operatinge her business, Fe is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pork and other ingredients needed for the products she sells. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Fe hopes to be able to expand her business soon as she dreams of having her own house and land through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy pork and other ingredients needed for the products she sells.

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en:
Zarah, aged 32, is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Redemptor, a stockman, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zarah operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Zarah's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Zarah is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Zarah hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Balganjav

texts.en:
Balganjav, aged 72, is a pensioner and his wife is also a pensioner. They live in their small wooden house in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and erratic electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two sons and the family of one of them are also living on his plot of land. His older son is single and runs a taxi business. His younger son has a family which consists of five members: his wife and three children. His younger son is a driver for a tour company and his wife doesn’t have a job. 

Balganjav started to build a house for his younger son’s family and the house is 20% complete. As every father loves his children, Balganjav is planning to build the house walls with materials such as cement, brick and glass-wool. This is to stop heat loss through the walls which, along with the house's interior decoration, will be built using energy-saving materials. A low-pressure furnace will be installed and this will emit less harmful chemicals into the atmosphere thus helping to save the environment. So that his grandchildren will live in comfortable conditions, Balganjav is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to complete the new house.

loans.use: to complete the new house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in the beauty salon.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from a rice retailer.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Irene is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teotima

texts.en:
Teotima is a 51-year-old married woman from Bohol in the Philippines, and a mother of seven children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to purchase feeds for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs. In the future, Teotima hopes to make her business a success and to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to purchase feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, 43, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nieto, who works abroad, and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Celia's business consists of buying and selling assorted toys and similar products. Basically, she buys toy products from wholesalers, repackages them, and sells them at a small profit. Her customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices she charges and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more candies and toy products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Celia hopes to grow her business soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products, such as different toys, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Lutchie

texts.en:
Lutchie, aged 28, is a resident of Bacoor, Philippines. She is married to Ersus, a worker, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lutchie operates a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month's credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and thus they earn the profits that they depend on as their income. Lutchie's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Lutchie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments, etc. needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lutchie hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of her family having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies and merchandise products needed for her business.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en: As Ni Ketut has a local sow, she will use her new loan to purchase pig feed and renovate the barn. The sow will give birth soon and she hopes the sow can give birth safely. Ni Ketut will sell the piglets after two months. She has already prepared for all their needs. Ni Ketut hopes that this time the business will run smoothly and that she will earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and renovate the barn

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is married with 3 kids and he is 58 years old, residing at Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.

Virgilio operates a fishing business to earn a living and has been in this business for 20 years . Each month, he earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Virgilio been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Virgilio wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
This is Titus, 48, resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines.  He is married to Adelaida, a house wife and a mother to their three children.  At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Titus oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community;  He earns from the daily revenue their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in revenue every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income.

Titus dreams to give his family a good future and hopes to give his children a good and quality education.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Esidora

texts.en:
Esidora is 33 years old, married with only child. She is presently residing at Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.

She has been engaged in this business for a year to make a living.  She had requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used as additional capital for hog raising.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman of this activity through the help of this institution.

loans.use: to be used as additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Antipina

texts.en:
Antipina is married with ten adult children. She is 60 years old and lives in Trigos, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Antipina sells a variety of snacks. She has had this business for 25 years. Each week, she earns approximately PHP 400 in her snack business.

Antipina has been a member of PMPC for five years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP. 

In the future, Antipina hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiaga  vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 10 enfants dont il supporte les charges. Il évolue depuis plus de 20 ans dans le secteur du commerce et s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires. Il est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu acheter du riz, de l’arachide et du mil  qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif consiste à diversifier les denrées qu’il commercialise. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de mieux subvenir aux besoins primaires de sa famille. 
-
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiaga lives in Senegal. He is a married father of ten dependent children. He has been a merchant for over 20 years, and is currently selling foodstuffs. He is a member of UIMCEC.

Mr. Ndiaga is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy rice, groundnuts and millet for resale. He wants to diversify his merchandise. The income earned through this activity allow him to better provide for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts and millet for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firewood and green leafy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family.  Leonora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store like coffee, sugar, milk, sardines, etc.. Leonora has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store like coffee, sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en: The Sari Wangi Ternak group members will all receive the same amount from their new group loan. The loan will still be used to support pig businesses. Ni Luh will use her loan to purchase two piglets and will rear them to become sows. When she has three sows, she has planned that if each sow has 10 piglets, then she will have 30 piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Luh will arrange that the pigs will not be pregnant  at the same time. She will also prepare mixed feed. She hopes that her plan will run well and that she will become a piglet seller in her village.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets

loans.name: Ana Dianira

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que ya son independientes, cada quien aporta un poco para la canasta básica, Ana se dedica a la venta de tortillas, en una hornilla de casa que no es plancha y usa un molendero para la masa, dos hijas le ayudan a la venta, su horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
Actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprarse maíz y un plancha de hacer pupusas que sera utilizada para hacer tortillas, para realizar la inversión solicita un préstamo que le permita comprarse lo antes mencionado, ayudándole a mejorar el negocio, le dará mas agilidad y atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Ana es tener un negocio más fortalecido, contar con la satisfacción de los clientes, con una atención rápida y más calidad en la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and their adult children. Each person in her household contributes a little to pay the family's basic expenses. Ana makes a living selling tortillas. She uses a grinder to make the masa (dough for tortillas) and she cooks them in a small household oven. Her two daughters then help her to sell the tortillas she makes. Ana works from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. each day.

Currently, Ana needs to buy corn and a grill for making pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) that she can use to make more tortillas. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in these items for her business. This will help her to improve her business and give her more flexibility and let her better attend to her customers. 

Ana's goal is to strengthen her business and keep her customers satisfied by providing quick service and high-quality tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and a grill for making pupusas (a typical dish from El Salvador).

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
To continue expanding their pig businesses, Wayan and her Usaha Ternak group will receive their new loan. In addition to purchasing piglets, the loan will be used to buy pig feed.

Wayan bought new pigs and now fattens piglets. She will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets each of which will cost 400 IDR and she will rear them for five months. Wayan hopes that her plans will succeed and that she will be able to renovate her kitchen from the profit from this business.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of  canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks propane gas to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth forma parte del Banco Comunal “Frutos del Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de la Florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 10 años. Se desempeña trabajando en las ferias movilizando sus mercadería en su triciclo, los días jueves, sábados y domingos, ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa para damas y caballeros, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para su negocio la compra en locales donde encuentra ropa de diferentes modelos, tallas y también ropa interior a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa y un triciclo.
Una de las metas de Ruth es poder comprar un furgón para poder desplazarse mas cómodamente con su mercadería, ya que no puede realizar fuerzas o movimientos bruscos por su cadera  que se encuentra delicada, así también comprar con más facilidad y llevarse la mercadería en su furgón.
Ruth vive junto a su hijo quien trabaja. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es adaptar un espacio en su casa para poner su negocio y no trabajar más en ferias, ya que es sacrificado.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
Ruth is part of the communal bank "Frutos del Progreso," that is part of the community of La Florida, located in the city of Santiago. She has sold clothing for ten years. She began working on market days, moving her merchandise on a tricycle on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays, offering all kinds of clothing for men and women. Her working schedule is made up according to her availability. She needs merchandise for her business and she purchases it from different locales where they offer different styles, sizes and also underwear at low costs, or at least reasonable prices. 

This loan will help her purchase clothing and a tricycle. 

One of the goals that Ruth has is to be able to purchase a truck that she can use to sell her clothing more comfortably because she can no longer continue as she has due to her hip that is very delicate and she will also be able to purchase clothing more easily and carry it in her truck. 

Ruth lives with one child who works. Her dream is to adapt a space in her home to locate her business and not have to work anymore on market days. 
She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable with the company and the other members of her bank. They all have different activities and interests, which serves as a moment of distraction for her. She respects the training that is shared at the meetings and has learned how to administer her business in a better way. 

La Florida is a community located in the Southeast of Santiago, capital of Chile. The population is very diverse and represents all sectors of society (upper class, upper middle, middle and lower middles classes). The area has an active commercial life which is evident in the existence of a variety of business centers. It is an area that has seen an explosive population growth in recent years.

loans.use: purchase clothing and a tricycle

loans.name: Engjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe, a Christian devotee who volunteers and frequents the church, is an Egyptian woman and a mother of one grown child who lives in the suburbs of a major city in southeastern Albania. She has been a VisionFund Albania client for long time and has gained respect from VFA’s staff because she proved to be a very responsible person.
 
Engjellushe is requesting a loan from Kiva through VisionFund Albania to make some minor home renovations and she hopes that lenders will understand her situation and lend to her. The amount of loan Engellushe is requesting is 50,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To make some minor renovations to her one room-house.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia  is 64 years old and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with six children. 

Cresencia has a store  that sells variety of products softdrinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for ten years.  She requested a loan of PHP 49,900 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste soap and etc.

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for eleven years.  In the future, Cresencia hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste soap and etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 60-year-old widowed farmer from Kitale county in Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years, producing horticultural crops and poultry products which she sells at the local market. She runs a grocery as an additional source of income. Diseases and inadequate capital are the major challenges she is facing in her business.

Mary is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, which she will resell. This will provide her with extra income that will boost her financial status. She plans to double her production in the next five years. Mary is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
El Sr. Fausto es casado con la Sra. Andresa hace varios años.Fausto; sale a vender menudencias en su moto propia que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo.
Además de su trabajo, la Sra. Andresa trabaja como macatera para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar. Ellos viven en casa propia y con su trabajo la pueden mantener. El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de menudencias, y así seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fausto has been married to Andresa for several years.  Fausto goes out to sell giblets on his own motorcycle, which he bought with great effort.

In addition to her work, Andresa works as a street vendor to help her husband with the household expenses.  They live in their own house and are able to support it with their work.  He has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person in his commitments.

He's requesting this loan to buy giblets, to continue offering his customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy giblets

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lkhagvasuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 5-year-old daughter in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a driver for a local company. In addition, he also runs his taxi business after he finishes work. 

Lkhagvasuren is a very hard-working man. Every night between 9pm and 2am and full-time on every weekend he operates his taxi business. His wife graduated from university this summer and three months ago, she started work as a human resources manager for the Cashmere fashion company. His daughter attends kindergarten. 

Lkhagvasuren is asking for a loan to buy furniture for his home such as a sofa and TV. By doing this, his living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home such as a sofa and TV

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Damas Unidas se formó con la unión de 17 señoras, vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité se esfuerzan por sobresalir en cada uno de sus trabajos. Ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad y su meta es poder ayudar a sus familias y salir de la pobreza.
Asunción, la presidenta, cuenta que vende prendas de variadas clases y marcas, comenta que es un poco difícil, porque hay mucha competencia, pero comenta que lo que importa es diferenciarse y tener buenos productos que es lo que importa a los clientes. Ella esta saliendo adelante y está creciendo, y eso la pone muy feliz.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusas, jeans, pantalones y demás prendas para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group Damas Unidas (United Women) formed with 17 women who are neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the group work to get ahead every day in their work. The women are friends and neighbors in this city and their goal is to be able to help their families and rise out of poverty. 

Asunción is the President of the group and she sells all kinds of garments from a variety of brands. She tells us that it is a little hard because there is a lot of competition but she says that it is important to her to distinguish herself and have good products, which is what is important to clients. She is getting ahead and her business is growing and this makes her very happy.

She is asking for this loan to purchase t-shirts, shirts, blouses, jeans, pants and more garments in order to continue working.

loans.use: purchase t-shirts, shirts, blouses, jeans, pants and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 37 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children.
 
Meriam has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products, and she earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing groceries and other consumable products for her business.

Meriam has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Meriam hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Evalistasi

texts.en:
Evalistasi is 39-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

He is in the business of commercial agriculture where he grows crops to sell. He obtained capital for his banana trade, which he still does by delivering them to homes.

Like most good parents, he dreams of building a good residential house and educating his children up to the university level. 

His business dream is to buy more land to expand his farming activities, but since agriculture is seasonal, he wants to venture into a salon business after assessing its financial potential and the need to earn daily income.

Evalistasi is requesting a loan to to open up a salon.

loans.use: to open up a salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish and nail cutters needed for manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sisenanda

texts.en:
Sisenanda is a 63-year-old married woman from Duero, Boho and is the mother of seven adult children. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now.

Sisenanda wants to expand her business but she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is therefore applying for a loan with CEVI in order to increase her stocks for selling to her customers. The loan will be used to buy additional groceries such as canned goods, noodles, snack food, coffee and beverages to sell in her store. In the future, Sisenanda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, noodles, snack food, coffee and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Arlene has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 20 years. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Arlene has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock  like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell. Before this loan, she has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF. Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials needed in making furniture

loans.name: Zanja Honda Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ZANJA HONDA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Verónica tiene 26 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 14 años, todos ellos en edad escolar,   La Sra. Verónica  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la localidad de ZANJA HONDA de ahí el nombre del grupo,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Verónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The communal bank Zanja Honda is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The President of the bank is Mrs. Verónica who is 26 years old and she has two children who are 5 and 14 years old and of school age. Mrs. Verónica sells a variety of items of basic necessity like groceries, sweets, sodas and a variety of other items from her store in her neighborhood that is located in the town of Zanja Honda, which is where the group gets its name. This is her second loan with the institution and Mrs. Verónica will use it to purchase a variety of groceries to stock her business like rice, beans, flour and sugar. With the larger stock, she will be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She is asking for this loan to improve her business. Mrs. Verónica will use the earnings to continue purchasing products and this will improve her income. Her wish is to have a larger space to be able to offer a better service to her customers. Mrs. Verónica is a hard working person and she is happy for the opportunity that she has been offered because her partners in the group, in many cases, are people that get their families ahead all alone.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to stock their business with rice, beans, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. Elvira earns additional income from farming sugar cane.

Elvira is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell in her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Elvira dreams of saving enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stock of peanuts and ingredients for making samosas.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and is married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gloria has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from selling rice.

Gloria is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is aged 28. She is a farmer in Kitale county, where she lives with her husband and five children, only four of whom are schooling. She has been in farming for the past 13 years, producing maize and beans, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will sell the milk, which will help her get extra income and use the proceeds to uplift her living standards and educate her children. She aspires to have two dairy cows and a poultry farm in the next five years.

Competition and poor market prices are her major challenges in farming.

Ruth is glad she joined Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Hedije

texts.en:
Hedije is an Egyptian mother of six children who lives in central Albania, in a major city where most of her community lives. Unfortunately, two of her children are disabled, and she has to look after them in addition to providing financial support for all. 

“It is very difficult and painful and becomes discouraging at times, but I’ve got no other choices. I don’t know what will happen to my two disabled children when I grow a bit older and I won't be able to provide all these …”  Hedije said.

In the past 20 years, Hedije has been selling used clothes; however, now she wants to sell fabric raw material, and this is the reason she applied for a loan for the first time. Seeing the success of others in her community who sell such items, she’s been convinced that this is the right path for her as well.

loans.use: To buy fabric raw materials to resell

loans.name: Carmela Isabel

texts.es:
Carmela es una mujer de 29 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Carmela pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carmela trabaja como vendedora en una librería de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Carmela se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carmela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de productos de belleza, tales como maquillaje, cremas, cosméticos, perfumes, entre otros; de esta manera Carmela podrá iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmela is a 29 year old, single woman and lives in Chiclayo.  She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to her efforts and her family’s support, Carmela was able to study for a career in Computer Information Technology.  In her spare time, she entertains herself watching television and sometimes cooks a delicious “arroz de pato” (duck rice) to share with her family.

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Carmela works as a salesperson in a bookstore in her city.  She begins work early in the morning every day and may work for about ten hours.  Carmela feels comfortable doing her job and believes that it is going well because of her good performance and the kind treatment she provides to her customers.

Carmela is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase beauty products such as make-up, creams, cosmetics, perfume, and other items.  In this way, Carmela will be able to start a small business selling beauty products.  So, she will continue working and striving to get ahead and achieve her great dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stuffed toys and bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 59 years old and lives in Ospital, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Lolita has a general store  that sells variety of products such as soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of Php 49,900 to to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap etc.

Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Lolita hopes to have a lot of savings someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 59-year-old hard-working married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who is involved in a number of activities such as second-hand clothes, a hardware store, motorcycle transport and rentals. He started his businesses so that he could educate his children and secure a future for them. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to exploit the existing market and his dream is to trade in wholesale.

Paul intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dariimaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in their own house in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works at private company as a driver. Her son, Buyandelger, aged 12, and her daughter, Monhtuya, aged 16, are secondary school students. She has been working at a private oil company as a cashier for the last 6 years. She is planning to purchase an Eco-friendly car to let her husband start a taxi service business for a living. 

Mrs. Dariimaa needs 4,600,000 MNT to purchase an Eco-friendly gas and electric car for her husband to start up a taxi service business. She is a diligent and communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase an Eco-friendly gas and electric car for her husband's new taxi service business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone load (credit) from GLOBE and SMART to resell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has four children. She is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Evelyn operates a sari-sari general store to earn a living. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP from her work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.
Evelyn has been a member of PMPC during this year. Evelyn hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Crisby

texts.en:
Crisby is 39 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has three children but unfortunately is now separated from his wife. Crisby is engaged in cutting and selling lumber, and he earns approximately PHP3,000 each month from his work. He has requested a loan to be used in paying for logs and lumber, and for labor and other expenses involved in cutting lumber for his existing business. 
Crisby joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Crisby hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for logs and lumber, and for labor and other expenses.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy's primary business is farming. She has also sold second-hand clothes as a secondary business for the past twenty years. Her monthly income is KES 14,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more clothes to sell.

With the anticipated profits from her businesses, Nancy will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export farm products, to expand her business selling clothes, and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm and more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a hardworking woman who is very responsible in her daily activities. She is 43 years old and lives alone in the rural area of Tiribe, which is located in the Coast Province. She is a divorcee and is very industrious. 

Chizi sells mats from home and in the market, a business that allows her to meet household expenses, since this is her only source of income. She is taking out a loan to buy more mats to sell. With this process, Chizi will increase her clientele and her sales and thus her income. She also plans to start a goat meat business, to take advantage of the December festive season.

loans.use: to buy more mats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid  con su anterior credikiva compró carnes frías, queso y aumentó el surtido y con ello sus ventas. Desde que recibió su crédito, ha logrado aportar mas recursos a su hogar y con ello han aumentado su bienestar.  En la actualidad está aplicando aun segundo financiamiento con el cual comprará dulcería, carnes frías y queso con los cuales planea impactar a sus clientes en la época navideña, pues son los alimentos que mas comparten las familias en estas fiestas. Con el credikiva también comprará repuestos y pagará la mano de obra pues su congelador requiere mantenimiento preventivo en un segundo nivel. Ella dice a sus financiadores  de Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo para crecer y así poyar mi familia: “
texts.en: With her previous loan, Ingrid bought cold cuts and cheese. She stocked up and therefore increased her sales. Ever since she obtained her loan, she has been able to bring home increased earnings and thus she has improved her well-being. She's currently applying for her second loan which she'll use to purchase sweets, cold cuts and cheese. She plans to make an impact on her customers during Christmas season, since these types of food are the ones that families most often partake of on the holidays. In addition, with this loan she'll also purchase spare parts and pay for labor, because her freezer is in need of preventive maintenance. She tells her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for giving me support so I can grow and therefore support my family".

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cold cuts and cheese, and also to purchase spare parts and pay for labor in order to do maintenance on her freezer.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es: Existen mujeres que ven pasar la vida y otras que deciden enfrentar de frente cada situación que se presenta en el camino, este es el caso de María Nelly una mujer de 46 años que debido a su difícil situación económica, busca la forma de consolidar su proyecto de negocio, como medio de sustento, debido a que es una mujer sola. Su mayor anhelo es obtener dinero suficiente para adquirir surtido y generar ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida, por ello recurre a un crédito que le permita realizar su sueño
texts.en: There are women who watch life pass, and there are others who decide to confront head on every situation in their path. This is the case with Maria Nelly, a woman of 46, who, due to her difficult economic situation,  is looking for a way to strengthen her business project as a means of support, since she is a single woman. Her greatest desire is to obtain sufficient money to acquire stock and generate income that will allow her to have a better quality of life. To do that, she is turning to a loan that will allow her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy stock for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase the materials used in bakery and sweets products

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky is a 35-year-old resident of Carangan, Ozamis City. For 3 years, she has provided her 7 children's needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business as an aid to the income gained from her husband. She became a member of GDMPC in 2009. Jinky has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 13,500 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Jinky wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is taking out a new loan to expand his existing business. He is very happy now that the previous loan had a great positive impact on his living standards. This new loan will help him to purchase more flour, basic grains, and instant products. This way he is sure to continue increasing sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, basic grains, and instant products.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky, a 25-year old, is a single entrepreneur of Lapasan, Clarin. He is earning from his transport service business. It has been running for almost 5 years now and he earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he has borrowed the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC - which he has just joined recently - to buy accessories and tyres. Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy accessories and tyres.
